lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ashley Johnson unfortunately cannot join us this evening. She's finishing up stuff at Blindspot, but we hope to have her back next week.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Ashley Johnson! Blindspot!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come back, Shane!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Travis will be taking over Scanlan until he arrives.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if you kill him? What if he dies while you're--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know you were kidding, but now you have to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Whatever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll see what transpires by the time he gets here. Hopefully he'll have a character left.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can do a limerick. It'll be exciting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Way to prove me wrong!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What happened?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No singing Travis?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He must have heard on Twitch and came running.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, that can't happen. No way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's amazing. All right. Well, welcome!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) Man, I didn't get to masturbate in public.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, night's still young, Travis.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's always tomorrow, darling.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You think Grog is above that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Remember, Twitch is live. That's not going to happen. So yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh shit, it's in my car.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What happened?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What do you need, what do you need?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's okay. I'm good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're going to wing it? You remember your numbers? Yeah, go get it, we're doing announcements.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's literally in my other car.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I can text you your character sheet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But I have my PDF.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have your PDF, you're good. Okay, so. I think--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pathfinder!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, if I recall, I think I may have left that behind as well. I made an extra copy of your character.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've made an extra copy of your character.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next Monday, 7:00pm-10:00pm, possibly a little over that, we'll see. You know how these sessions go. I'll be running a game of Pathfinder. Taliesin and Marisha will be playing, as well as Ivan Van Norman, as he is allowing us to take his spot for No Survivors, he will be a player in that game, as well as two special guests. We'll have Ashly Burch, the wonderful, talented, amazing Ashly Burch will be playing, as well as the incredible Phil Lamarr. That'll be our troop of five players.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Justice League, Futurama, Pulp Fiction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tales from the Borderlands?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yup. Ashly Burch, who's currently up for a BAFTA as well. 'Cause apparently if your name's Ashley, you get nominated for a BAFTA.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The BAFTAs already happened. She didn't.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But she was nominated!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: BAFTA nominee Ashly Burch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exactly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's also a delightful knucklehead, so BAFTA aside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's awesome people. Love her to death and we're excited to have her on. But yeah, so that'll be next Monday, 7:00pm Pacific here. Come watch, it'll be fun! It'll be a little different than the usual stuff here. Let's see. Next up, if my phone would listen, there we go. Next week, next Thursday is our 50th episode. Crazy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Explosion. Brain matter everywhere.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll have a game, couple surprises, and we'll be finishing it off with a grand Critmas finale for this year until we get in the holidays.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's all happening that night?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We don't have a choice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Longest night ever!

lines.name: MARISHA, MATT
lines.text: Longest night ever!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We were going to try and find another night maybe to do Critmas, but their scheduling won't allow it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Cheers to a seven-hour stream.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh god, I'm going to die.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're prepping to try and make it transition as fast as possible so we aren't here until 4:00am.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And by they're you mean us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Come next week for an awesome spectacular! It'll be great! You'll enjoy it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Spectacular, spectacular.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good. Marisha, you want to talk about Hector's thing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hector Navarro, aka @Hectorisfunny on Twitter, is the next host up for Signal Boost, and his first episode happened this Tuesday and he's fucking hilarious. You have to watch him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He is, it's great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's really funny. And this coming up episode might be one of my favorite ones.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the opening joke for this next episode made me laugh out loud on the ground for five minutes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, that's a true story.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't build it up too much. Now they'll be expecting it, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the best thing you've ever seen. You will die it's so funny!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Anyway, give him love. Go watch it. It's funny. It's very funny. And he has great things that he boosts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exactly. Let's see. Also, if you guys haven't seen it, we did a fun one-shot game with Kinda Funny, with Greg Miller and their crew up in San Francisco and the episodes have been going up this week, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday, finishing with today, so if you want to go check it out, it's a ridiculous two-hour game we played, broken up over four episodes. I think the full episode goes up standalone tomorrow, but it's a lot of fun. We had Travis, Laura and Marisha all playing in that game and--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Different characters. We weren't our regular characters, but equally fun, I thought.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Who'd you play?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I played Jester, a tiefling cleric.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, it was delightful. Marisha, what'd you play?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What was my character's name?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You were a dwarf paladin.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know, but what was my character's name?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think it was Scottish McSweedsen. Accent McDialect.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, hello!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look, a lot's happened in a couple weeks, okay? I've moved, I've had a change of scenery--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's true. But yeah, that's fun. Travis, you got to play an Order of the Lycan Blood Hunter.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I did. McLaren von Tosscobble. Oh, it was fun. He has secrets. And bourbon. He had lots of bourbon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So much bourbon. We may have been drinking during that game, I don't know. But go check it out if you haven't. It was a lot of fun. Sam, you had an announcement you wanted to make?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I play Zedd in the Ratchet and Clank game that just came out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a good game.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a good game, it's getting good reviews! I haven't seen what I did in it, but I assume it's nerdy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good man. Fantastical. Liam--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey man, I know you guys all love Wyrmwood Gaming, but like this free-- the shipping is killing me. Well the good news is, if you use the code "critrole" you don't have to pay the shipping, you just pay the cost for the box and they send it to you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. These glorious boxes?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: These boxes by Wyrmwood Gaming. The code again is "critrole". Not only that, but they have a Kickstarter going on. They are now selling, or they're kickstarting their Sentinel deck box, which looks like this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh wait, I haven't seen this yet!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So wait, this is a regular Sentinel deck box.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is a regular. Now, for fans of the show, you can get our logo etched into any of the boxes at any tier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is another box. This one has our logo etched into it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What does it say at the bottom there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can do a rubbing on the front.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It says "How do you want to do this?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But again, if you want to go full Gilmore, we have the Masterworks box, which is freaking gorgeous. The dice go in here, the Bluetooth is hidden in there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bluetooth?!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You'll never lose your shit. And then all your cards go there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Put your weed in there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're not supposed to just come out and say it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I do a sleight of hand roll?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So all the rules for how the contest works are there. And you can get one of these for looking at their Facebook page.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sweet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Critrole!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Crit. Role!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the milestone we're hitting for subscribers?

lines.name: CREW
lines.text: I think it's 16,800?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So 16,800. When we hit that tonight, we'll be giving away the next giveaway, which will include this as well as art posters, and all the other good stuff we give away as part of our subscriber giveaways, so that's cool. Thank you, Midnight Syndicate, you guys are awesome. Check out their stuff on the internet for your own home games. It's brilliant stuff. All righty! So, without further ado, let's get back into the realm of Exandria.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: When we last left off, we were in a cardboard box.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. In Hobotown, USA.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I knew this day would come.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So last we left off, Vox Machina, having traversed many places in the world in hopes of finding a way to expel or destroy the Chroma Conclave, a collective of four chromatic dragons that together managed to destroy large bastions of society on the continent of Tal'Dorei and beyond in Wildemount. Thordak, the Cinder King, the seeming leader of their group, currently sits in the center of the partially destroyed city of Emon. The other dragons have scattered about and claimed their own territories. From this, the party has discovered the existence of these legendary magical items, referred to as the Vestiges of Divergence, that existed from wars long past. They were carried on from generation to generation that contain power that may be sufficient to defeat these creatures. You were sent to seek out the nameless sphinx that exists somewhere near the Frostweald. Weeld-weld. It's pronounced so many different ways--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which is it? Which is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Frostweald.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it's right in between it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's in that weird place.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Frost Wilfred Brimley

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frost Brimley. Frost Brimley is the most dangerous of forests, by the way. Everyone gets diabetes. Sorry. Somewhere the sphinx exists in the Frostweald, which the nameless mate to Osysa, the gynosphinx you met in Vasselheim, sent you to go seek out this information. Upon going to the town of Westruun to the north, it had been partially destroyed by the black dragon Umbrasyl, and in its absence had been taken over by what seems to be Grog's roving barbarian herd.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dicks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Total dicks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Found amongst the stone ruins of previous victims of the basilisks, you found most of Tyriok Gadsworth, the wandering cartographer, now missing a portion of his right arm. However, he is restored and alive, which is much better than how he was before and is currently leading you guys towards a camp of orcs, supposedly nearby, as some of the survivors of Westruun's destruction were camping far south and some were being captured by this roving orc camp. So you guys have just stepped away from the obelisk and the remains of these basilisks you've slaughtered. As Tyriok leads you guys from where he last saw-- at least where he saw some roving orcs before he found himself turned to stone in that previous area. As you travel along, the cold midday air of this forest, there's no wind. It's very still and very quiet, which is unsettling in a place that's so out and open in nature. Your boots are crunching through the snow, step after step, but you're still being as careful and as quiet as you can, moving along. Tyriok is shivering in the cold and one of you manages to pull out one of your extra blankets you have in the Bag of Holding to keep him from going into hypothermia. You guys press on for about ten minutes or so, and he's trying to look around and look at the placement of the sun, look at different areas that he'd seen within the forest and he's thinking to himself. "All right, so I recognize that mountain spire, time "of the day, that way is north, west. Follow me!" And he continues to lead you in that direction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And all of that with just a stump.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. You're terrible.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tyriok, do you have a weapon on you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The best weapon I have is right here."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, right, on your way, lad. (whispers) He's going to die first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's trouncing through the snow, little bit ahead, stopping, looking about, before you realize that he's a huge target, he's making a lot of noise.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Didn't we discuss sending him home?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he had to show us where the orcs were.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I said he shouldn't come, but no--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did I cast Pass Without a Trace on us before we headed out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You cast it before the battle. I don't recall if you cast it afterwards.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then I'll cast it again so that he's incorporated in it and I think we should try to stealth it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You going to tell him?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey. Hey, Wonderbrain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it would be smart if we moved as quietly as possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Why, that's what I was doing. Perhaps I should stand in the back, then, if you guys want "to go... Loosely that way, about 300 paces to the right of the second stone you see with the large "outcropping that looks like a gorilla's face, and then continue. I'll guide you from back here."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that sounds legit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He steps to the back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know, keep a distance. When you hear no more fighting, it's probably safe. Probably.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay, okay."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I walk up alongside him and say, listen, I know you're not used to weaponry, but take this, please. It's a loaner. And I take my Keen Dagger and I stick it in his hand.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? No, don't-- I take it back and I give another dagger to him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I give him the Keen Dagger and say, hold this. It's a loner. It's very sharp. Be careful with it, all right? If you get caught on your own, stab. That's all you got to do, is stab.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Stab the other person, not yourself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His eyes don't leave the blade and he goes, "Okay."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't accidentally stab yourself because I think it sucks your life energy out of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is not what that does.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes it does, it definitely sucks your life.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: At a disadvantage since I contradicted her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's another knife I have.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh really?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a giant die.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's not above 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, "Perhaps this is best suited for someone who knows how to wield such dark powers."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think you are so right. And I'll take that from you. And in exchange, I will give you this wonderful opal dagger that I have on my person.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh. This is more my speed."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Still very sharp.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know what that one does? It makes you infertile.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Give me this, you fucking hoarder. What's the matter with you? What are you--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, can you feel it in your little bits rumbling? They're all going to sleep

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Perhaps you have a third or fourth dagger I can try."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? What did he just tell you? I wasn't paying attention.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look, I'm a man of the truth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's lying. He always lies, don't pay any attention to him. You're safe with that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I push him off, ten feet away from the group, and I pull out the same Keen Dagger--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jesus!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here's a different one. This is a normal dagger.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How about I take no dagger and I stay away from this? You guys are starting to be a little "weird." And he hands you the secondary dagger and he puts his one hand up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I just don't want what happened to you before to happen again, all right? You can even put it in your belt, just have it. All right? It's a normal dagger, it's fine. My sister is intimidating.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "To say the least. All right."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Vax, just because he's holding a dagger doesn't mean he's going to be successful at using it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're wasting your time-- never mind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hold on to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay." As you guys start walking, his eyes don't leave the blade as he takes each step and (whoosh).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then as he walks away, it poofs back into his fucking belt.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it doesn't.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, so we head towards the outcropping that looks like a gorilla's face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so I'll have you guys all roll a perception check, if you could.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Perception check. First one!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Heh, natural 19.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't see anything at all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Off to the races.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I'm sorry, 30. 30.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rolled a 19, my Perception's 11.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think you notice things and have an epiphany at that point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are walking, Keyleth shoots her arms out in a stop motion, and you look off and you can see past the clump of trees, maybe 60 feet ahead of you guys, two hulking-looking humanoids tromping through the snow, dragging something behind them. You hear the distant crunch of the snow and there's shape, but it's darker in the area where they are in the distance. Can't really make out a form, but you figure these are probably orcish in nature based on their gait and their outline.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) What is it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I look at the group and I go--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Two deer. Santa Claus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hello, salute, running away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Milking a cow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Cha-cha slide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Use your words, Keyleth. Talk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, okay. it looked like there were two orcs and they were carrying a body.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are they headed this way?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, they're headed away from us, correct? Away, they're going away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eh, parallel, a little bit away.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I cast Pass Without a Trace on us, so should we stealth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Have you guys all roll stealth now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Still flat grassland, or are there some trees?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it's relatively thick trees, relative canopy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Rolling stealth plus ten.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank goodness. 22.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 29. What?!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You got a natural 20?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 45, holy shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You don't know where you are anymore at that point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am one-dimensional.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what are you guys going to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's a dot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: From our previous time in the Frostweald, we don't recognize any of this terrain right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, you recognize the terrain. It's a large forest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No landmarks, no lakes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to go look for that, you could, but--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there any paths in front of us, or is it just trees and intermittent terrain?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If there are paths, they're under so much snow and relatively fresh snow that's perpetually piled on this region, they're not visible at the moment. You can occasional hoofprints in the snow from some wildlife that might live in the vicinity of the forest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't you like this terrain?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, so what should we do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're looking for orcs. They're what we're looking for. Aren't they going where we want to go?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's pace and slowly approach.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like it. Can I search the ground and see if there are a lot of tracks around? Or is this like a roaming party?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you can see around, you don't see any tracks from them specifically in front of you, from where they're travelling, it appears to just be the two of them right now. They're either scouts or hunters, and the closer you guys, as you slowly approach, to get a better view, they're both dragging what look to be like two boars that were killed, are currently being dragged by their legs over their shoulders, leaving a trail of crimson in the snow behind them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we should take them out before they get back to their group.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait. What is our overall goal here? Are we to slay a bunch of orcs or are we to follow them somewhere?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're supposed to slay them and stop them from--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Number two and then number one. Follow them and then kill the rest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We want to get rid of all of them, so follow these guys back to the bee's nest and we can take care of the hive.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, well let's follow silently.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why don't I go a little bit ahead, you follow behind by about 50 paces and the rest of the group behind you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But what if we kill them now, we won't have to fight them--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then we won't know where the camp is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But I can follow tracks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Can you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There won't be tracks if they're dead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're not coming from where they're from, they're going.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They were just hunting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fine! Fuck it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's follow them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We follow them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you don't catch up, you follow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: At a safe distance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you guys continue moving forward, watching them as they go, at a far enough distance. Pike's doing her best to walk behind in the snow, but it's okay! She's barely moving her upper body to make sure it's minimal amount of movement.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not far ahead, but I'm ahead. I'm like 30 yards ahead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Listening out, you can hear the occasional laughter, too far away to hear any sort of language, not that I think you understand or know the language Orcish, but eventually they come over a hill, and down, and you see it first as you crest over. You can see there is a small clearing in the forest of this area, where there are two tents, what looks to be relatively filth-stained tents, like they've been used for an extended period of time, covered in dirt and mud and other things. You can see a small pile of skinned bodies to a side of one of the tents.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) Oh! They're definitely bad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispers) I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And these bundled-up orcs are sitting around the fires, drinking. You can see some of them have random silver mugs or cups, some have steins, some have carved pieces of bark that are used as a means of drinking. You can see outside of these tents what appear to be large barrels or casks of wine or liquor that have been probably raided from the camp they found outside of the lake. You can see a couple of them are much larger than the other orcs. One of them is sitting down by the fire and is chuckling with the rest. You see to the back of the camp, there is one that's taking javelins and chucking them up in the air, and they're arcing through. And every time he chucks one, you hear a (scared noise), and as soon as you move to the edge of it, you look over and there is a young man who's strung up by his torso from one of the trees and it looks like a few of the orcs are making target practice. They've already hit him twice. There's one that's sticking out of his thigh and another one that's embedded itself in his shoulder, and little trails of blood streaking down, but he is currently strung up like a piñata and they're having fun with him. You take a moment as the rest of the group catches up to you on the edge and you can see there are a few other people being kept inside the tents right now. One large orc musters out, adorned in thicker armor than the rest of them. He has a band across his head with a big old rough, uncut gem on the front. He starts barking out orders to a few of them. One of the larger ones stands up, and he's probably a good foot taller than the other orcs, lumbers to the back of the two tents and you can see there are two bears that are currently chained up to the back. He reaches over and grabs one of the skinned bodies from the side of the tent and throws it to the two bears and they immediately start tearing it apart and eating it. At this point the rest of the party catches up to you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, so I saw that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. But they're still a ways off, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Since you have--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa! It's a cozy camp.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, look at that camp!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's fire, there's bears.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where are the wine barrels?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The barrels are right there, right there, and right there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, there's the guy hanging up in the tree!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where, where, where? Can you point out those barrels one more time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There, there, and there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So next to the tents that the prisoners are being kept in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. We have options, people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They haven't noticed you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far back are we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are probably back here, a good 60 feet outside of the outskirts of the camp. They don't seem to have noticed your approach and this is entirely however you guys want to approach this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, well, I turn back to the group.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What time of day is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's mid-afternoon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we rest? Are we rested? Yeah, we had a night in the-- wait, no. We just killed those--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you haven't rested since the basilisks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, so we're down a couple spells, or whatever.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, but I'm full on hit points. Is anyone hurt?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I'm a little hurt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was a bump in the road, the basilisks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Okay. Hey, oi! So do I create a distraction while you go around back? Do we go in guns blazing? What's the plan? I can distract.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it would be good to create a distraction. We go in, save the prisoners and then take out the camp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So a distraction that would get everyone to run towards me and ignore you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then we can stealth down--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can we go around the sides--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Flank them?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan, you create a distraction--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As they're running--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: -- closer to here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You want to get that guy down to the treeline and get the people out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. I'll draw them away from the tents.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. And then, once everyone's clear, we bring them back and kill them all? Or what?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, this may be it for orcs? This could be all of them, or it could be just a forward camp, so we need to keep one alive.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And find out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And find out if this is the end of it, or if there's more.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fair.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good thinking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do we get all the prisoners out very quickly?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You have knives. You could cut your way through the back of the tent.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan, could you potentially put all the people in the door?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Also takes a minute to cast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, Scanlan can create a distraction, I can possibly take a few people out with my ranged spells along the way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm saying get the prisoners safe so that nobody's running blindly into the forest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've lost track of all you've done in the past 24 hours. Could you send everybody through a tree, even back to where their people are?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not today.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if you spent some time, a minute, creating your mansion, you have a little door here. Once you've created a distraction, we can all run up and put them in the door and then we fight. And then we get the people out of the mansion.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, that's good. That's good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Interesting idea. It's an interesting idea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I kind of like it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I like it too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They can go down to the workout room, so they don't soil the other chambers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not concentration. I mean, it's concentration for a minute, but then after it's cast, it's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Once it's cast, it's 24 hours that door stays there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, all your little Mr. Meeseeks will take care of them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But we still have to get them out of the camp and into the door, unless I make the door in the camp.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Make the door, make the door at the back of the camp. And that way, we can run them out the back of the tents.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not near the bears.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You need to go full Burt Reynolds out in front of that camp and get the bulk of them running towards you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't do both.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Make the door first.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no, hey look. I'm good for a distraction.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Blow your shawm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm fine with distractions, but I can't go to the back of the camp and set a door and to the front of the camp and draw them out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let Scanlan handle-- I almost called him Scandal, which is still appropriate. Let Scanlan handle the door, I can handle the distraction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: All right

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, so we sneak around to the back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm really good at distractions.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You are, you're incredibly good at distractions.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But you're the only one who can make a Hefner mansion out of thin air.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I'm to sneak in and make a door and await further instructions?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll all go together.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll make the door far enough away.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, Keyleth does the distraction. As soon as she goes, you go. So once those guys start running towards her--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How far away are we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are probably about 60 feet away from the far outside of the campline, so around this ring here, just outside of where the table edges are.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But we're talking like 150 feet? 200 feet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're probably closer to about 60 feet away right now, you can move for--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, well, we're fine. I can make the door from 300 feet away. So we're fine. So I can make the door right now before we do anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do it, make the door!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Except there's going to be a glowing door in their camp.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Make the door behind one of those trees.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Okay, I'm going to go ahead and do it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, fuck it, just do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Get ready to do a distraction right fucking now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But you know what you're doing, right? Wait! Let's get in position! You and I can do a lot more hurt to these guys if we're closer to the position we have to go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, flank around, flank around. It's going to take me a minute to cast the spell. You have a minute to get into position.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So who all's flanking around? All right, so the twins and Percy, where are you guys going?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll take the long way around, this way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over here?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Far side?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: With an eye for the shithead who's tormenting that guy in the tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, are you going with him?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I'm staying on the other side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, Percy, you're going with Vax?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to go, actually, right over here. I'm going to hide over here and I'm going to try and get a bead on the guy on the tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, easy enough. You get a bead on him, in the outskirts there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pike and I will go with Vax.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, she's not a good sneaker.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going to be right there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Charge in after the distraction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Grog, where are you going?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll go with Vax.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keeping your guys' existing stealth checks, which were okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I was a 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Pike did come? We said Pike could stay, because she's not stealthy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not stealthy. Okay then. She stays there. So Pike's going to go-- Scanlan, you're moving back? Where are you going?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm staying next to Keyleth because I can do this from a range.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where do you guys want to go-- Keyleth, for this distraction?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where's Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, don't do the distraction yet! I haven't set the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where do you guys want to set up for the distraction?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where did you go, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm right next to you. We want to do it--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we want to do it towards us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We want to distract around here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then run the other direction.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you guys are set up right about there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, that's where we wanted-- Put us more--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, he knows. We're back right now, but that's where we will end up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're further back. I can only put you so far away from the table edge.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, that's good, that's good, that's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Pike's going to stay up with you, since you have the bead right now and if worse comes to worst, she can help rush in and try and help at that point. All right, so who's doing what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to start casting the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I'm going to do it back behind camp, on the treeline or whatever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, back far this way?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, just out of eyeshot of them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, I'll put this little dice on the corner to represent where the door is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that's good, that's good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I turn to Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm moving a little closer, just a bit, stay there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come with you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The opposite of that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Go away from you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is your spot, this is your spot! And I creep towards the trees, a tree closest to me, so I can get closer. Which is the orc that's throwing the javelins on that map?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These two right here are taking turns.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, moving up to here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The other tree closer to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, and I'll hold there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Who's up next? Who's doing what?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Waiting for the distraction.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you want me to go in and you can cast something? I'll get their attention and you can cast something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I have a Monster Manual?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For what?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Conjure Woodland Beings?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you want the app?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's not many that you can conjure. It's pixies and little things.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that's little creatures.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's okay, she knows what she's doing. No, she doesn't.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I can conjure a bunch of little creatures.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can search. Search!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you make a bunch of David the Gnomes--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seriously, like a giant scorpion would be probably pretty cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fire elemental? Big, bright fire elemental?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, but then it wouldn't be me. It'd be something else that's not me that I can control?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy's taking the bead, waiting for the distraction.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just do it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to say Conjure Woodland Beings.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you conjuring?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have to know what you're doing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, that's what I'm trying to figure out. You know, there's not a list of what you can conjure in the book.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, there's not.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And it's very unfortunate. And it's some kind of fey creature. So what's a fey creature that's a challenge rating of two that would make sense? That's really scary?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fairies?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or I can also summon like eight fairies if they're a low enough, you know--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I hate conjuration spells, by the way guys, so you all know. The worst spells in the whole game.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does it really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It does, at the end of the spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah it says the DM will have the statistics.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It says the DM will have the creatures.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, conjuration's great, when you're not the DM.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't know me, you don't know what lists I have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How about some dryads?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dryads?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll go see what their challenge rating is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That sounds cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Past the devils.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll give you level-two challenge rating.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And no, we're not doing the whole pixies Polymorph. That's so dumb. Not even going to lie.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Challenge rating of two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Challenge rating of one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's got to be a fey. Oh, it only has a challenge rating of one?

lines.name: LAURA, LIAM
lines.text: Centaur!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What are centaurs?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Centaurs are not fey, are they?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Apparently.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They are!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Green dragon wyrmling!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm getting bored.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't think centaurs are fey.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Well then, let's do two dryads.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two dryads. You can do up to two challenge rating--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sings) Five gold rings!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two triads. Dryads. I don't know what it is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Will o' the wisp!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two dryads.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We will say here, two dryads. Where are they going?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right in where--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Front and center.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you. Yep, here. Ish.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: See this, Matt?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here. No, there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah that's a little out. And Scanlan and I are far back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now, suddenly the dryads pop into being and these two humanoid green nature entities that look humanoid but are covered with leaves and their skin has the texture of bark in places. Beautiful, wistful, both appear, summoned out of the ether and land on the snow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Crunch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ground gives out from under them, they both go, (screams) and fall into a pit here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh shit!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: See, aren't you glad that wasn't me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Good job.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Couldn't have gone with the will o' the wisp.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A pit?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They would have floated right above it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This whole section here has now crumpled below. The dryads, however, have to make a save.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of them saves.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But that wasn't us!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That wasn't us!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That wasn't you guys. Like right there? Okay!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wasn't me! It's all I care about!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is the most Douglas Adams beginning of a fight ever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (screams) And the other one you hear is breathing heavily from the inside right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth is standing at the edge of the forest going--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point, a bunch of the orcs turn around. I need both of you guys to-- let's see, because they're making active perception. What was your stealth check, Sam?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 15, but it doesn't matter. I'm walking forward.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckles) Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to cast the Resilient Sphere on myself. And I'm going to roll into camp. Hamster-style.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, can I go with you a little bit?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a thing with him?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If he says don't, then--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then probably don't.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, let him do his thing. It's marble madness, everybody.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to start singing to get their attention. (sings 'Tro-lo-lo')

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just avoid the pit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. All 60 feet, you avoid the pit, you roll around, all the orcs look over. "Huh? "Stupid gnome!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Very stupid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Initiative has now kicked in; I need everyone to roll initiative. (laughs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jesus Christ.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's a good roll!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, hell yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Spent all that time figuring out what I was going to do and then they fell in a crack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You did great! You exposed the trap! You saved--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's true!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you'd conjured a will-o'-wisp, it would have been you in that hole.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If I had just gone out, I would have fallen in the hole!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's all right, Wendy will draw some dryads falling into the spikes--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Initiative orders. 25 to 20?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, 25. So we have Vax. 24, Percy.

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.text: 45-- (cheering)
