lines.text: Nice. All right, what was the attack?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, it's a plus one because we took a short rest, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: When you take a short rest, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That wipes it. Right? Or a long rest wipes it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. I believe for Craven Edge--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Craven Edge. Strength loss/gain from this feature lasts until your next short rest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Short rest, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So it's just plus one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you can say you don't have to take a short rest if you don't want to. It's up to you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I didn't want to! I'm not hit. I was fine! I was literally untouched.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, if you wanted to keep it, you would have been able to walk around aggressively and maintain it. That's fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Aggressively.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) Walk around aggressively.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 27 on the third one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's the damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, that's the damage, all right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I use it against the bear?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or just the person, is he the only other one in range?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, if you're rolling to hit, right? Whoever you're attacking, the AC differs. So what was your attack roll on that one?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was a 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Damage the bear.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was the damage, was 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27 points against the bear, got you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so after completely gutting the first guy, you turn around and slam the axe into the hide of the bear. Up close, you can see, the bear, unlike Trinket, edges of its shoulders and parts of its spine, you can see bone protruding out in points and juts. It's different, a little more dangerous than a regular bear you've encountered at the get-go. However, your blade does sink a good four to five inches into its hide, cleaving a giant wound in its side. It howls and seems very pissed off. But so are you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does he have to make a constitution--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He did make his save at 15.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Son of a bitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That end your turn?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends your turn! All right, back up to the top. Vax, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, I'm still hidden, so I'm going to move along the side of the tent behind those barrels. And I want to throw two daggers at the magic-using orc.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Magic-using orc?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Didn't you say one of them was with a circlet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh. That one?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah, right there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, and I'm going to use my Sharpshooter ability to do negative five to the attack roll, plus ten to damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To the damage? Go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: First one--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You should roll in your box.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I need Wyrmwood! Critrole. 17 from the first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 17 hits. And the second one is 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 misses, unfortunately.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Misses, but the sneak attack damage travels on the first dagger.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes it does.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes it does. So here it comes. (counting) 33. 33 plus six! 39.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 39, is that with the plus ten? Sharpshooter?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh. No, it's not!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So 49.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It sinks right into the back, between the shoulder blades of the chief orc of this group. You see his whole body tenses up from the severe amount of pain and he tries to reach at from the back and spins around, looking straight at you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, go fuck yourself. I stare him down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to grab the javelin really quick. I'm going to walk over to the guy who's just starting to crawl out of the pit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Javelin goes right in the face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll for an attack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm using it as a stabbing weapon. I'm not letting go until he drops.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, no. I understand. I do not believe the javelin is finesse. So this may be a strength-based attack. Let me double-check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But it's already happened.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fine. It wasn't about the strength!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it's your strength bonus plus five.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Strength bonus plus five?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With advantage because he's hanging over a--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your strength modifier?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So plus six for this roll.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Plus six?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Technically, you get advantage because he's there, technically prone as he's getting up out of the--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Six, seven, eight, nine, 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11. Your first attack you whiff. He ducks out of the way, actually pulling down into the pit and it misses his head, and he gets up again and extends a hand to reach out towards your ankle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What a Raiders moment!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! Totally.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, totally Indy-ed it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: First shot to the face. That's still better. 17 to hit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. That's 15 points of piercing damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as he reaches out for your ankle, you pull a pistol out and he looks up at you. The front of his head detonates and he slumps backward, falling into the pit silently.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Silently. Oh no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to look up to see if anybody has noticed that this has happened.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The two guys that were throwing javelins at you have watched this happen. They seem unaffected, they're just really pissed off at you. Orcs aren't-- they're used to seeing their friends die, they keep coming at you, so these two are like, (growls).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, I'm going to pick one of them and take another shot. The one on the left, I'm going to take a-- yeah, let's do a sharpshooter shot on him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your left, okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, our left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Stage right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that'll hit. 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 26 hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 17 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 points of damage, got it. This one is a gut shot, hits him on the side of the stomach and you can see part of the back of the armor blow out, and he grabs it for a second and keeps looking towards you, seemingly un-fully phased by the impact of the blow. Going to stay where you are?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ending Percy's turn, Keyleth, you're up. Vex, you're on deck.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to take the two dudes who are in front of me, you can tell me if I can do this twice or not, I want to do my multi-slam attack, my multi-attack slam, and I want to go, in as dictated in Common as I can as an earth elemental, knock. Knock. And I want to take their heads and go, boof-boof.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Okay, so you'll move one, two to get into combat range with two of them. Go ahead and make a slam attack against each of them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Against each of them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Natural 19 on the first one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And a natural 18 on the second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to say those both hit. Go ahead and roll slam damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (rock voice) Knock-knock.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (rock voice) Knock-knock. (normal voice) First attack is 13 plus-- 18 points. Second, not as good, ten points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten points. So you take the larger orc who's coming at you with full plate armor and this greataxe that it's bearing towards you, hacked at you twice last round, and the one that just got shot in its gut by Percy. You stumble in the front of them and they both look up at you for a second, snarl before you go, "Knock-knock." (whack) Crack their heads together. The one that Percy shot pulls back, its nose is smashed and it's a smear of blood on the front of its face, it's still standing but it stumbles back a bit. The other orc, however, as you pull back in your hand you look down, most of its face is completely caved in, you hear a slight gurgle and a little blub of blood come out of what used to be its mouth before its body goes limp in your grasp.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I take his body and chuck it in the hole?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, you take it and throw it over your head. It arcs right in front of you, Percy, down into the pit. You hear a (yelp) as the final remnants of the dryad are crushed by the fall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It served its purpose.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. That finishes your turn, Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vex, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, me? I thought Travis was after--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm at the bottom of the round.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, every time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, he changed his initiative.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay. I want to shoot Trinket out into a Cannonball from--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, this'll be your action to do this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to move up to where I'm lined up with all of that row, so this whole shebang right here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. All of these guys.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, please me too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And you too, because you practiced it with him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Take out the thing and say, Trinket! Cannonball! And shoot him out and try to roll into all those guys there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so using your action and Trinket's bonus action as part of the attack here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's Trinket's movement?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: His move is 40.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 40. You have 40, landing right there. Go ahead and roll three attacks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Three attacks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good boy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god, really? He gets advantage because he's awesome.

lines.name: MATT, LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He rolled pretty fricking bad. 12?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 hits the bear. It's a big bear. What's the second attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 just hits the orc. And the third one?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One!

lines.name: MATT, LAURA
lines.text: Miss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so go ahead and roll the Cannonball damage on those two.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It should be on Trinket's sheet as one of the attacks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cannonball, exclamation point. Cannonball.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you don't have it written down, I have it in my--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, go for that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know what, you sent it to me forever ago, it's in my email somewhere, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay. I have it here in my pdf, it's fine. As part of your beastmaster--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you tell me what magical beasts I can conjure while you're at it, because--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I will fight you. All right, 2d6 plus eight bludgeoning damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 2d6 plus eight, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, the one that missed does get an opportunity attack against Trinket.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, snap.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I suck. 2d6 plus eight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, that's not bad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 12 on the first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, 12 on the first. As the bear slams into the larger bear, like rolling over the top, and then comes down onto the second, the other target, the orc, smashing into him. The orc almost gets knocked off his feet and then the third one sidesteps and swings at Trinket, so go ahead and roll damage for the second orc.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's better. 17 on the second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. Trinket crushes the other orc who'd already been softened up from the blow from Keyleth's earth elemental.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, good job Trinket!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Trinket rolls past, you can see this crushed form of the orc on the ground in the snow, crushed in place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good job, buddy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The third one, however, sidesteps and is going to go ahead and take a swing at Trinket. That is going to be a 19 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20. Right across the top of Trinket's armor, no effect.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can't even hit a bear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really dizzy though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be your turn, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That brings us to Pike. Pike--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I use my bonus, though? Do I have a bonus action on top of that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hide?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did not start your round hidden, unfortunately. Or did you? Oh no, you did, you did! You totally did, yes, so you can hide. Roll stealth. You'll have to move back over here--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you move back behind the tree so you can find a place to hide. And then you go ahead and vanish. Cartoon-style, like run behind the tree and don't come out the other side.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does she paddle the canoe down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike's going to go ahead and, one, two, three, four, five. With the view there is going to go ahead--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on, golden child. I want the Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike's going to go ahead and continue to run over here, because she sees that the guy who's hanging up there who has three javelins stuck in him now is like passed out and bleeding.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's making her way around to try and heal him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Such an Ashley thing to do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Their turn now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This guy here is going to go ahead and converge, well no, locked in with Trinket, he's not going to take the attack of opportunity from him. This guy's going to move here, that orc's going to move around to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look at how teeny Trinket is compared to the other bears!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. This bear's going to go ahead and move in on you, Marisha. Big old dire-bear-looking creature bearing down on you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I brace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so. The war chief begins to scream out, (yelling in Orcish), pointing at you, Grog. And you see the other orc on the other side goes, (yells) and seems to be energized by the rousing cry that it's given, so advantage on attack rolls for all within earshot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, give us a tickle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This guy's actually going to move--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, maybe it's another spell or something, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Paladin or some shit like that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, it's a very paladin thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Man, that's a good thing to have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So since I moved him up last round because he was hiding behind a tree there, so the other larger orc, the one that was tending the bears rushes up alongside with you as well, Keyleth. All right, so the war chief is going to make one attack as a bonus action, it can do that against you, Grog, with advantage. That's going to be a 22 to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That'll hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You take 16 points of slashing damage, reduced to eight, because you're raging, so eight points of slashing damage as the war chief comes down with its greataxe. It sinks a few inches into your shoulder and it carves it down, almost matching the scar you have across your chest, and grinning at you the whole time. As you grin back at it, his friend is going to come up with its greataxe and is going to come down, this is with advantage as well. That's going to be a 17 to hit?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That misses. As it comes up overhead to try and swing down to go towards the top of the nape of your neck and head area, you notice out of the corner of your eye, bring up your sword and deflect it down into the snow behind you, looking over your shoulder at it. The bear is now going to come up alongside and is going to make a bite and a claw attack against you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is going to be a 19 to hit?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's 19, my armor class.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's going to be a 21 to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep, both hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you take nine points of piercing damage as it bites you, reduced to four. We'll say four, I'm trying to round down consistently going forward. So you take four points of piercing damage from that, and then you take 12, reduced to six slashing damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. Ten total?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Total of 11 points of damage. Or ten, you're right. From the bear. Bear attacking you, actually no, first the orc attacking Trinket now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With advantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh man, that's a 16 even with advantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ha!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just slamming a greataxe over Trinket's armor, Trinket--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket's yawning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bear against you, Keyleth, that's going to be a natural 20 with the bite.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ouch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And natural 20 with the claws. Two natural 20s in a row, that bear wanted a piece of you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth was like, aw, cute. (screams)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18, 24. We're looking at 30, no, 42 points of damage on you in your elemental form from the bear.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Damn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bear bites into you and takes a mouthful of stone and tears a chunk out of the front of your sternum area and then with its claw swipes across your face, ripping part of your elemental jaw, exposing a little bit of soft earth beneath.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Soft earth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was your good jaw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The other large orc, the larger one with its axe is going to take two attacks with its greataxe against you. That is a 21 to hit and an 18 to hit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, I'm getting attacked by someone else, too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the other large orc there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, both of those hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You take 24 points of slashing damage as both of the greataxe blows come on from the other side, you're being--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --chiseled down now. Yes. That's going to end their turn. That brings us to Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have I freed them from their shackles?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say as your action this turn, you will have been able to get them both out of their rope-binds, including the one that has the broken arm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. The construction of the tent, can I lift up the back and shuttle them out that way, or do I have to cut through it or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not-- the back flap is currently hit into the ground with a stake. It shouldn't be too hard to lift it up if you want to try.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know what, I'll walk them out the front door, point them towards the mansion. And say: run, do not walk, to my beautiful, beautiful house.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which way do you want to go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To the right, stage right when I get out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So right there? Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just enough to get them around the tent, yeah, and on their way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They come out, seeing all the action happening, looking really nervous. Give you a nod, and the woman says, "Thank you." And they both turn, and if you point out the shimmering light, they (running) and bolt off spending the entirety of their round--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I yell to them, wipe your feet before you go in! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, they won't quite reach the door, but they're on their way out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's pretty much all I can move, you think?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From there, yeah. Tiny gnome feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Do I have a bonus action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I will-- I can only really see Keyleth around, right? Everyone else is hiding?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't see-- well, you see Pike, because you're running behind. Pike is not making any tink-tink-tink. Behind you, you can see Grog in a frenzy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm hidden by Keyleth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you can't see Percy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to end your turn, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All this love for me, I'm flattered. And I would like to use all three of my frenzied rage attacks against the bear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. First attack?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: First one, reckless, all three reckless, the first two normal, maybe the third Great Weapon Master, we'll see. 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 hits. Roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes. Awesome. Six, 11, 20, that's 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20. With that, you take the axe and you swing it in a wide arc across the front of the bear's body. As you hit the edge of the bone, it splinters at the impact, and its shoulder-joint is knocked out. The sword continues and cuts right halfway into its throat and actually manages to cut through a very main artery and the bear begins to bleed out on the spot, onto the ground.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that an automatic failed constitution save?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With the constitution of the bear, no, it makes it. 14.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But he's dead, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is dead, the bear is no longer of the realm of the living.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So I killed somebody, so I get an extra attack, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You still get, it's your bonus action--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, it's the bonus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. So unless-- it's only helpful when you're not frenzying.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Beautiful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: When you're frenzying you get it every turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I get it all the time!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So can I turn to my right--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To the next bloke.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Regular one or the war chief?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The war chief, let's try the war chief.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, all right. Regular attack or Great Weapon Master?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Regular, because I've just got two left so we'll see how regular does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22 hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. Makes his constitution save. So already still wounded and bleeding from the dagger that Vax left in him earlier, you manage to take the blade down, sweeping across the front of its armor, cutting and actually destroying and causing this jagged edge to the front of its armored breastplate. Make your next attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The third one, let's do Great Weapon Master.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it. With advantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Orc down, orc down!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So roll damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you multiply that by two. Right? Before the modifier.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Before the modifier, it was--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 2d6, which you rolled what?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I rolled a 12. Or no, it was seven plus five and then my rage modifier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, so it's seven times two, so 14 plus your modifier and your rage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow, which is ten now. And Great Weapon Master is ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. So that's plus 20 is what you're looking at on top of that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So 14 plus 20, 34, and then roll 4d6 on top of that, Brutal Critical.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ten. No. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Jesus.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to stick the hilt of Craven Edge into the snow and reach forward and grab his shoulders and pull him onto the point of the sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you throw the blade down, handle-first, it falls a little bit forward. You reach forward and grab the war chief and pull him down onto the blade. He looks up at you, staring into your face the entire time as you pull him over each jagged inch of the blade.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, let's see the light leave those eyes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The life expires as it falls forward on the blade. Let me go ahead and make a constitution save. That is 18, makes it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's it, that's my turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was a good turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But he is done, that war chief is done. Well done. That brings us to Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, I'm going to curve around to the front of the tent I'm at and start aiming at the larger orc who's whacking on Keyleth there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, glancing at the tent by the way, you do see there are a few people in there that are still bound and shaking and trying to look out and see what's happening.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I see them, I note them, and I'm throwing two daggers at the person attacking Keyleth, the thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: First one is, and I'm using-- I'm going to use Luck. That's a point, straight up in the air.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 16, and I was using the minus five, so the first one probably misses, 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, that guy right there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that misses unfortunately.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, second one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or it doesn't miss, it hits him but it hits the armor plates of his full plate, it's too, or the plate of the armor it's wearing is too strong and the blade can't pierce it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Second one is a 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That does hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Which hits, and since he's up against Keyleth I get sneak attack damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So here comes the damage. (counting) 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, as you let loose the second dagger, it catches him right in the center of the face, embedding itself between his eyes, and one wanders off as the momentum carries it forward three or four steps. (thudding) And grinds its face into the ground right before reaching you, into the fire. The body catches flame as soon as it lands, collapsing into one of the campfires and it begins to burn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry, sweetheart. And I feel the dagger go--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, to the side of your Blinkback Belt. All right, do you want to stay right there? You have more movement if you want to use it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How much left? Like five or ten?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Three more squares, 15 feet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to walk up right up next to Keyleth in front of the bear. One, can I go diagonally?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Through the fire, you can if you want to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an acrobatics check, go for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, yeah, you basically run and leap up over the body of the guy you just killed, using him as a stepping stone, and you see ash and embers (whoosh) out the side as the pressure pushes him further into the fireplace. You leap in the air, land next to the one orc that's attacking Trinket and right next to where Keyleth is currently standing as the earth elemental.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not unlike a raven taking flight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Aren't you far away?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (uncannily good crow noises)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, you're up. That was way too good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've been paid good money for that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your turn.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can emote as a bird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whose? His.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy's turn, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My turn. Look at that, is there only one guy standing now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are two guys standing right now, and a bear.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I'll look at that guy who's right in front of me--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two guys and a bear with Charlie Sheen, new to CBS.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, disadvantage on your next roll.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For the rest of the arc.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, what've you got?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take a push shot, I haven't tried a push shot before, I'm going to do a push shot on that guy in front of me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 29.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 29 hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, that's 13 points of damage and he pushes directly away from me ten feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He does. Into the fire.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: and is currently in danger of catching fire.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's good. And then, let's see, the bear is a still a problem, isn't he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll sneak another shot at the bear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is going to be a sharpshooter and a trick shot, I can't take both at the same time, can I, it's one or the other?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, sharpshooter is your feat. Trick shot, you can't take multiple trick shots, but you can sharpshooter and--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And trick shot. I'm going to sharpshooter and trick shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Made a mistake once, we learned.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And that's 23?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23 hits. Big bear. It's not that hard to hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not that hard to hit? Has to take a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is 11.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, he has disadvantage on attacks until the end of his next turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Headshot?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you go ahead and roll damage for that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is this against the bear?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. 25 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 points of damage. You-- after you fire, the one orc stumbling back and catching flames, you turn around and look at the bear. Fire again, it strikes the front of its bony ridge on its head, where the brow line is, shattering part of the bone and causing it to rear back. Looks very disoriented. It's still angry and ready to swipe, but it doesn't really know where it's standing at the moment.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to burn through my action surge really quickly and reload and take two more shots. Two more sharpshooter shots, nothing fancy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Against?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The bear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The bear? Go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't be a happy bear, be a sad bear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 20 points of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That actually, with that shot, you aim for the other part of the brow, release it, and with that it shatters part of the bear's face. You hit a part of the bone ridge that causes the front of the skull to break, and you can see part of its face collapses a bit as the bear, in a pile on the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So I have one last shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I spend a grit to try and shoot the rope that's holding that guy in the tree?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You have disadvantage if you do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Disadvantage. Grit or no grit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, oh sorry, to use a grit point...

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can actually technically get advantage on the shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I was going to say, you could, yeah. So if you want to do that, go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ah! The golden snitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, you aim, take a moment, fire the bullet. You catch it in a way where it doesn't completely cut the rope, it's one of those rare perfect shots where it takes two of the three threads that holds the rope together, as they untether, it causes his body to (creaks) and it causes him to begin to sway a little bit. As the counter-sway comes back, it snaps, and it manages to catch him to hit the edge of the tree, fall into a few branches that break his fall, and he tumbles out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ow!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Only taking one point of damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can't even kill a kitten with that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can't even kill a kitten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was a one in a million shot right there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, it was a one in 20 shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One in 20 for you, yeah. One in a million for anybody else. But you're Percival.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, cool. That brings us to Keyleth, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who's left alive?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are two orcs, one that's currently on fire and down in the flame trying to pull itself up. The other is currently whaling on Grog out of anger, but is starting to look around and notice it's not a very good situation.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No no, stay, we've got party favors.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth, what have you got?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we still trying to keep one alive?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure we are.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure. All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I assume the one that isn't on fire, but you know, that's my opinion.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, sure. I want to earth glide underneath and pop up underneath of him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This guy here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The fire guy, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The fire guy. He's actually on top of another larger orc, so you burst through, the fire is destroyed and you see a bunch of the stone is thrown aside, what was the campfire has now been detonated in a burst of snow and earth. You burst out. Are you catching him?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. That's cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You catch the guy who's on fire, currently holding him above you. What are you going to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: First, I want to stamp him out in the fire, in the snow, sorry. Stamp out his fire in the snow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're clutching him. He's flailing about in your grip. Fire's out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then I'm going to, I want to grapple onto him. I want to start dragging him over to this nearby tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So make a grapple check, it's an athletics.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Athletics?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've only got basic stats here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a d20, add your strength modifier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He rolled a one. Yep. Through the flames and the chaos, he can't even resist, and you have him in a full grapple. He's not restrained, he can still attack, but he's at disadvantage on all his attacks, but he can't move, his movement is zero and you're currently holding him in place.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Can I start dragging him over so--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At half-speed, yeah, you've already done 20 feet to get there, so you can move him ten feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I'll slowly start dragging him to this tree over here. So we can tie him up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One, two. That's as far as you can drag him there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're pulling him back, and he's like, (struggling noises).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that ends your turn. Vex, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, I'm going to turn Trinket around, he's going to attack that dude that got a hit on him. The one behind him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right here? Oh, the one behind him is the one that currently is being dragged away after being set on fire.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's one on me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, he runs up to the one on Grog. But he moves out of the way so that I can get a clean shot on him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Moves around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And he bites him and he claws him!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is your bonus action?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Huh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're giving him the attack on the bonus action?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I still get a bonus action, he gets to attack and I get to attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so yeah, so you get one attack and he gets both attacks. Go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He bites the shit out of him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, go ahead and roll damage on that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) "Gosh darn it!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is that, 13? No, 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12, all right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then I'm going to shoot him from my hiding spot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you dart out from behind the tree and release an arrow, go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get it, girl.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't hit me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's all right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great. 16 plus sneak attack. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 points of damage. This arrow strikes him in the side of the throat, he gurgles and falls on the ground. As he's trying to grab, Trinket uses that and pounces on top and rips out, tears its throat out.

lines.name: LAURA, TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That orc is done. Currently, at this moment, the camp is cleared out except for the one that Keyleth's currently grappling, and you guys all turn around and you can see now, there is the other tent still filled with people. The other two here disappear into the mansion's doorway.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (rock voice) Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, sweet, yeah, hold on. You hold one end, I'll hold the other. Wait. No, that might be something-- never mind. And I take out Craven Edge. I walk up to the orc that she's holding.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I put him in a nice little sleeper hold.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, look, mate. So unless you want to bleed or lose the head that's attached to your body, are there more of you around these parts?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intimidation check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think he can understand you, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He speaks fear.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I get advantage on those because I--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because of Craven Edge, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He says, "No. We are the only ones. I am the only one."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Have you had any dealings with the goliaths that are in Westruun?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We don't deal with goliaths." Spits blood, but it can only get, with what little bit of strength it has left, only dribbles down the chin in a not-very-aggressive way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anything else?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, we need to know, wait. Does he know anything else? Is there another camp, is there anything?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They just had some prisoners?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, is there any reason why I should leave you alive? (laughs) I love this question.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, "No. I should go to whoever made us. I will die here with my brethren. I will not "run a coward."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Has he seen a cave with a sphinx in it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, sphinx?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Before I dispatch you to your maker, have you seen a sphinx or a cave of magical origin around these parts?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Rot in Kord's prison, half-giant."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I take Craven Edge and I grab both of his ankles, and I pull them apart and I shove the blade up under his grundle, and then rip one of his legs off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a horrific display. Even the earth elemental takes a step back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fails the constitution saving throw.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: While that was going on, I wanted to run forward and work on the guy that fell from the tree. I wasn't paying attention to that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's unconscious, still, and he slowly comes to consciousness--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does he look like the description that we got?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's Cyrus. Bloodied, horribly brutalized, but alive. What's your strength at now?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus four to attack and plus 11 for damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your strength score at?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, score. It is now 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21, nice. Fuck, dude.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're stronger than Pike again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, only for a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are there any other prisoners still tied up?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'm in the other tent untying them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's three more in this side over here, you guys were--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Calming them down, looking for loot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was going to say, before I drop my earth elemental form I start busting open some of these crates for quick lootage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You should have a higher strength than 20 if you kept it from the last basilisk fight. Because you're 17, you got how many bonuses from that combat?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Seven from-- without the short rest, so it's been seven?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've got seven bonus benefits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're 24 then, aren't you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, only 21, because it takes two to go up the thing, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So. Every time they fail a saving throw, your strength goes up by one. Every two strength, you get a bonus.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's how it works.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. I'm at 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So your strength is 24.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) That's awesome!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which means your overall strength bonus should be plus seven.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Juicing, man, he's juicing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to turn that plus four to a plus seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because your strength modifier normally is plus three, correct?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it would be a plus four on top of whatever your normal attacking damage was already.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So your strength saving throw goes up by one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So plus four is correct. I had plus four down. Okay, got it. Got it, got it, got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus four on top of what you had normally, yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: On what I had normally.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's get this camp cleared and get these people inside Scanlan's love shack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're untying them, they're all, "Thank you, thank you so much, they took us in the night, "we didn't know, we thought we were dead." And some of them start breaking down into tears. There's a little girl in there that amongst everyone is probably the most stalwart, and is trying to calm one of the men that's sobbing, she's like, "It's okay, it's okay." And is patting him on the shoulder.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's always the kids, man. It's always the kids.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you survivors of Westruun?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes. We were up by the base and they came in the night and they killed my wife and they took "me. They took everything."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're safe now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As is your camp.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If I could ask, have you seen-- fuck, Wilhand?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wilhand?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, Wilhand. Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Small, older, gnomish fellow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The little girl pipes up and goes, "Yeah, yeah, Wilhand. He was as tall as me."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I drop down to my knees. You seem very brave. Do you know where Wilhand has gone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I haven't seen him since we left town."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So he stayed in the town.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I haven't seen him outside of it."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, the town. We were in the camp. Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's your name, darling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Vanessa."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vanessa. You're very strong, Vanessa.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you. You're very strong too."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, well, thank you. Do you like bears? Not those scary ones but really nice ones?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you see she's a little-- bears are a rough subject for her, she's probably seen them eat a few people she knew.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket sits back. He's friendly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: See? Totally nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket breaks free and licks you right across the face, your beard up to the side again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Here we go again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She chuckles.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I drop elemental form and start helping Pike heal whoever needs healing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I go for that circlet that was on the war chief.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, good call.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I inspect it first.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We should bury the dead. There's piles of dead, we should bury them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was it human bodies or animal bodies?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They were human bodies.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, of course, you're right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll put them in the pit and then we'll cover it up. Gimme a hand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Whatever you need.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're all in there being cleaned up, the servants are tending to them, and I mean, they'll be shat out of there in 24 hours, but--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's fine. They'll have a good night's sleep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point you hear a voice in the distance say, "Hey! Is everything all right?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, quite, come on over!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Walking out from behind a tree, a one-armed man. He comes running over. "I heard a lot of "craziness going on. Those-- you did good, saw a little bit of it."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you have to use your dagger at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, but I kept it there just in case." And he's still clutching it in his hand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's one standing behind you right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (yelps) Spins around and swings it, loses his grip of it, and it (dagger flying) into the tree, and he's like, runs over, grabs it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nobody saw that. Totally cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay, thank you." So you guys begin taking the bodies over and putting them into the pit on top of the orc that you blew most of the forehead off of.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Two orcs, what did we, two--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two dryads.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Two dryads, two orcs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The circlet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And amongst the goods that have been gathered here, if you should wish to return them or keep them for yourself, there is roughly 700 gold pieces amongst the other bits of dried food, starting-to-rot vegetables.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's a couple boars, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a couple boars that were dragged in, that have been killed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's eat the food that won't last and return, cook the boar and return.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is one unspoiled fire.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, can we take a short rest?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can also bring the food into the mansion and let the help cook it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's true. How about the casks, what's in the casks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're nothing special, these are probably grabbed by whoever ran a tavern in Westruun and took what they could during the chaos.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All ale and wine is special.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fair enough.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should take that, and wait, this meat, don't we have a cold bag? Don't we have a cooler?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We do!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's keep some meat.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That nothing is in!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we do have some stuff in it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Some stuff is in it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Keep some grain and meat or something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, yeah, I'm keeping some boar meat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But seriously, I eat some because I'm-- Keyleth's a little hungry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought you were a vegetarian.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, never said that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I try and roughly butcher this boar?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've done it pretty well. You butcher the boar, there's already a stump set up for you, previously used for not quite as humane reasons, but you manage to prepare the boar, cook it over the area here. As the sun slowly begins to set, you guys take your short rest. Is everyone taking a short rest?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not me, not me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you maintain your damage, you still maintain your--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, the sun is setting, are we taking a short rest or a long rest? Are we spending the night?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can't we go in your house?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course we can, yeah. Are we going to spend the night? What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about five o'clock in the afternoon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, little early.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's pack it in early. Who knows what'll happen tomorrow?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we going up to the mountain?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, tomorrow morning.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Do we need to scout up? How far to the mountaintop?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're not going to the mountaintop.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or the glowing place.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's probably about an hour and a half's travel on foot to get there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should go check it out before we go to bed, swing by on a broom or something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like it. I'll hop on the broom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, check it out and then? Your door is stationary, though, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door is stationary, the door is on the outside of this camp.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But everybody inside's safe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I stealth in the air?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not really.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I wrap myself in like my--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What? Aluminum foil?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, you will make a stealth check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You'll figure this broom out eventually.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to put it at disadvantage because you are, it's possible, but you're also a giant rocketing half-elf in the sky.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not that giant, okay?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow. Wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll disadvantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I usually get advantage, so I'll just roll regular.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I love your broom rolls so much.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Oh! You know what, I still have Pass Without a Trace, because I never cast Hunter's Mark to break that concentration.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You nerd.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would not remember that shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23. All right. Cool. Don't forget your point of exhaustion, Grog. From the end of the frenzied rage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go with her. You're going on the broom? Yeah, I'm going to turn into a mangy crow that looks like it would be with a witch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like it. (cackles)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll Polymorph.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Polymorph. You follow her as a crow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I perch on her shoulder. (crow sounds)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (unnervingly realistic crow noises)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's so creepy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (unnervingly realistic crow noises)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There, make a perception check, both of you, actually.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mine sucks. Natural one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm so scared of all my dice right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What you got?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17? Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh wait! Favored terrain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mountains?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're in the air, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Forest at the edge of the mountain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does not pertain to the forest, more of it's the mountain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17, okay. As the sun finally hits the edge of the mountain range and begins to set, and the light's starting to diminish, you're having a hard time picking out details. You know the general vicinity that Keyleth pointed at you, it takes longer than you anticipated, but eventually you come-- and there are a few small caves and entrances to the side of this mountain, but after you sweep past once or twice, doing a couple loops, one catches your eye. You look at it from this vantage point. It looks like a small inlet, like a cavern. As you get closer, unlike the other rough entrances, this one seems intentionally carved in the mountainside in a triangle. Directly about 30 feet to its peak, there is a triangular entrance to the very very base of this mountain that is recessed into the mountain rock itself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think we should land on the ground, we should just stay above.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (crow sounds)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (realistic crow sounds)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can't talk when you're a bird?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He cannot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. This is really smart, you coming, because we can't do anything. Do you want to pop out of that, can you pop back in? One caw for yes, two caws for no. You can't even understand me right now? This is ridiculous.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know, can I understand her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can understand her, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But she doesn't know if you understand.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I float down gracefully on the broom and give it a little bit of a closer look.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking inside, it goes dark about 25 feet in. Do you want to step further into the cavern?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No no no, I'm still in the air, I'm not on the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so yeah, looking inside about 25 feet past, what little bit of daylight that still exists disappears into the shadow of the cavern, you don't know anything beyond that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you think, Scanlan? Back up a little bit and shoot a flaming arrow into that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (caws)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sweet. I back up a little, far distance away, and shoot a flaming arrow into it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you pull out your arrow, the shaft ignites as you release it. It arcs forward and it lights up a little bit of the tunnel around it, tunnel continues--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good aim from the broom?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Decent aim.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, it's not a wide target, she's shooting it into an open 30-foot space.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And it's not moving, it's not fucking moving right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've watched Harry Potter, they always have two hands on the broom.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why are you trying to do this to me right now? Why you got to be a player hater?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Because it's fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She could take another shot and it would make it there anyway. You can see it go through, and it arcs and then disappears. You see what looks like an edge, and it vanishes past it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well. That looks deep. I don't think we should check this out on our own.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Might be fun.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're a bird, you could probably fly in and fly back out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. (caws) Okay, I'll fly in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You head down, coasting into the darkness. Does your form have--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have darkvision, I don't know what crows have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you have darkvision. But you, crows--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know what a crow has.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I will look it up real fast.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think a crow has darkvision.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hold on, hold on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're dark as night, man, of course they do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are they daytime birds? They're daytime birds. They're not owls.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're not owls.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should've been a fucking owl.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (owl sounds)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can do that too? Quick, do a nightingale.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you do not have darkvision as a--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I'm just flying around in the dark knocking into things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Essentially, you coast into the shadow, hitting a couple things. You eventually hit ceiling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ow!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And coast down and you land harshly, taking three points of damage in your crow form as you hit and land and tumble down a few stairs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, stairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At that point, you're in complete darkness right now, you can see a faint distant bit of light that's barely creeping in from the entrance you came from. Around you, though, nothing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll break form and come back as Scanlan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You come back as a gnome. Now your darkvision kicks in and indeed you can see there is a smoothly carved tunnel overhead that descends down a long flight of stairs. Make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you have 60-foot darkvision? As a gnome?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It just says darkvision. I didn't write down the distance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because this is important to know for this circumstance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: By the way, blackbird has a hit point of one, so technically you popped back into gnome form the second you hit the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does it actually have one hit point?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Darkvision is 60 feet, I wrote it down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 60 feet. I'll write it down for the future.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. So yeah, your vision just hits the edge of the staircase, which stops, and then continues forward. The darkness beyond there is obscured, or a hint of blue light that slightly shifts and glimmers beyond your vision. It seems like the tunnel ceiling ends as the path continues beyond that, and your vision is cut off beyond that. You cannot see, but you do see a very very faint blue shimmer coming from the tunnel beyond.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I float up to the edge of the mouth of the cave and say, (whispers) Scanlan?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (echoes) Scanlan, Scanlan, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow, I've always wanted that to happen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (echoes) Happen, happen--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) Are you alive?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I see down the blue thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can go down further if you want to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't want to go to where the blue is, I just want to see if I can peek down there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'd have to descend the stairs to. Because the actual tunnel continues down along with the roof and then as it continues past, it levels off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to die. I'm going to shoot one single Magic Missile into the space.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if that's his face?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you take the wand, and the Magic Missile, which gives a very faint candlelight glow around it as it is a burst of arcane energy, arcs down and slams into the stonework and filters out. The little flash you see at the base of the stairway, the stonework there is like a tiled square stonework, it looks like the further you descend, the more and more there is a constructed architecture to this place, however, the missile dashes against the stone tile floor at the bottom of the stairway. No other seeming reaction, that same blue glimmer unchanged.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I quickly pee a little on the side of the wall, just a little bit, okay. Zip up, turn into an owl and get outta there. At level five, because I'm out of level four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so. (hooting) An owl ascends quickly and spooks you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I stay at the mouth of the cave and say, (whispers) Scanlan, are you alive?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (echoing) Alive, alive, alive.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) Scanlan?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (echoing) Scanlan, Scanlan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait. Scanlan! Is that you? You were a crow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (confused hooting)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. That's you. Should we go?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're just turning your head 180 degrees back and forth, aren't you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should go back. One hoo for-- I start flying back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vex takes off on the broom. All right. You guys head back to the camp, make your way into the mansion, and rest for the evening. You don't rest for the evening?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're exhausted.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have one level of exhaustion, I'm okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to spend a little time tinkering before I sleep, working on the broom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I never stopped digging, can I assume that everybody's buried?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point in time, yeah. By the time they've been gone, everyone's been buried, everyone's been taken care of, and you make your way back, waiting at the door for your sister to return.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's the second level of exhaustion?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so yeah, for not taking your evening's rest you get a second level of exhaustion and your speed is halved.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. I want to see how far this can go. I want to push this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm willing to learn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hey guys, welcome back. So. Kicking into high gear to return to the game as it's going. You guys go through your restful evening, except for Grog, resting up and getting prepared for whatever comes your way, except for Grog. As you spend the night fending off sleep, staring at Craven Edge there on your lap, feeling the cold blade against your fingertips and considering and still feeling the strength that it's imbued upon you pulsing through your veins.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, could I ask it one question?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, it was a good day, right? Like, superb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you remember your former owners?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I do."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you remember Lord Briarwood?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I do."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How was he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mostly."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did he give you a goal? You know, before we put him into different pieces, he was, like, trying to build up this god called Vecna. You don't know anything about a god called Vecna, do you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Doesn't interest me."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just the blood.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Just the hunger."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, the hunger.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's all there is, is the hunger."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But look, we did really good today. So I'm not going to go to sleep, I'm going to carry this over the next day, I want to see how hard we can push this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So close to being full."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're close to being full? Hold on, how many more lives do you need?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm close."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you know, do you know what happens when you get full? Like, do you get bigger? Do I get stronger?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Feed me and you'll find out."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You've got it. Can I insight check the sword?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes please! (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've never been so happy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to read the blade, but the disposition doesn't seem to have changed any of your previous conversations, so seems hard to read. It's a sword.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Outstanding. I tell you what, if you get full, we'll celebrate this upcoming day as your birthday.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you insist, Grog Strongjaw."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And that'll do me for the night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You all come to, rallying your breakfast, your chicken-filled breakfast.

lines.name: LAURA
