lines.text: What the hell happened? What was down there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Really nasty plants. And I go over. I'm pretty sure my Control Water lasts for a minute, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Concentration.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dope. I'm going to go over, and can I start clearing the water out of this tunnel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where would you want it to go?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Out?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Up the stairs. Behind us is stairs up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't make water disappear. You can part it, you can do all kinds of things with it, the water still has to go somewhere.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Part it. An air tunnel for us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what I was thinking, making like an air tunnel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you want to do? The abilities you have to choose from are part water, redirect flow, whirlpool, but that's not really in your realm, or flood.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And how big was this tunnel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All the way across, I'd say it's about 25, 20 feet across.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a big tunnel. I'll part it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you dive back down? When are you starting to part it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I yell to everybody else and I say, there's a tunnel through to the other side. Let's go. And I jump in and I'll sink and I'll start parting the water behind me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or, let me see, let me sink to the bottom and then I'll part the water in the tunnel straight ahead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Do you guys follow suit?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I follow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we diving into water or parted water?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're diving into water right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And before I jump in, I say, don't touch the plants on the edge.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So we're going through water to get to air.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's what I'm hoping for, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it a fast drop, or do we float down with that water?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You float down, because she didn't part the water of the top of the tunnel, you guys float down at a natural pace, eventually touching the bottom of the subterranean tunnel, holding your breath. Keyleth moves her hands this way and the water in the center of the tunnel actually parts almost like a bubble in front of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nice!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You step into that open space now and you can breathe. You all catch yourself--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go fast while I still have this concentration.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're holding it at bay and you push it off to the side, elements, a lot of the water has been forced out of the top for the time being wherever you're going--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure, displacement physics.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. However, the planet life that was currently drifting freely is all to the ground, and is this giant mass of plant matter on the ground that is soaking wet and there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Don't touch the plants, let's go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Go where?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Forward.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it covering like a rug all in front of us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, there is plant matter all over the entire surface. It's thicker on the edges, because a lot of it dropped down on itself.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So are we able to pick our way through?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it looks like a bunch of wet fur on the sides. You guys begin walking, what's the marching order here? Who's going first?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll go first because I'm at disadvantage on everything, so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Grog goes first.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll go behind Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Who's after that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll go next.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take Pike and go after her.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll go behind them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Following up their rears.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Has Trinket stepped back into your necklace, by the way?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes yes yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Just making sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hold it up, show him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's in my necklace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, as you step past, and you're stepping with a squashing sound as your footfalls hit each of the sections of the dark brown-greenish plant matter. It's really soggy, and Keyleth, as you're concentrating, it's a lot of water to part, and you're basically creating this 20-foot tunnel. As you begin stepping across, you can see the red vines begin to pull their way out, but without the water there, they can't support the weight of the vine itself, so currently they're unable to really shift in your direction. You can see them trying, you can see the vines (slithering) in the matted mass, but they can't actually work towards--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can't move quickly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're assholes, don't touch them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see the curvature leading upward, there is still that barrier of water that's shimmering right there in front of you. You all eventually make it past that big central patch, and as it curves upward, you can look about 35 feet at a diagonal that way, you can see the surface of water that's where it breaks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Swim up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I take the Control Water and jettison us all up like I did with Grog?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hold on!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys all take a breath as the water wall collapses behind you, rushes up, and like a water jet all of you get jettisoned out and have to catch yourself on your feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Three-point landing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I catch myself on the broom and I fly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I definitely roll. How does Scanlan land?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Scanlan's more like a waterslide, he comes out the end and feet in the air. It's fun, but--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Slip-and-slide?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (groaning)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The worst!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's a rock.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We all know what you're talking about. You haven't lived.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're the best.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And when they're not wet enough.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see on each of these pillars, facing inward, or not inward, sorry, facing outward of these pillars, what looks to be these stone lion heads. They each face outward. The chamber is also circular, but much larger, it's actually 60 feet across, from the 30 feet of the first chamber you came to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right where we are, I'm going to take my Flametongue dagger and go in a circle and detect traps. Detect some traps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a very beautifully, very elegantly built room. You look around the walls. They themselves are smooth with, once again, no door, no exit, however, you look around the outside of the pool that you came out of, and there is a three-foot-wide gold loop around it, almost like there's a big circular gold plate that surrounds the pool, and inside it is carved a language that you can't understand. You recognize it again as Celestial.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh dear.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What does it say?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Dagger again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, this one translates to: "Betwixt the chaos, our order reigns, the ones who made us, "refined the planes. As ages die--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on. "The ones who made us--"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Refined the planes. As ages die, their time an ember, the four endure, the four remember."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Aren't there four dragons?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That can't be what this is about.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why not?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because we killed one of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It could be four sphinxes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's four lion heads in the room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you look up as well, as you glance at more of the scenery, and you put the dagger up, right above where the pool is, there is a beautiful circular mural, the size of the room itself, 60 feet across from end to end.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How high is the ceiling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ceiling is 40 feet tall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If it's in Celestial and it says, "those who made us," I highly doubt that the dragons are the ones that made the architects of this structure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If you recall, there were also five dragons and we killed one of them already.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, it's four sphinxes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Four somethings in the room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing up across the mural, this beautifully painted image shows flames twisting and writhing in an arced pattern that then twist into broken rock and soil and earth and mountains that then break once again, sinking into an angry ocean, and that ocean then begins to rise into clouds into the sky, those clouds then dissipating and turning into raw flame and continuing the loop.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's the water cycle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Elements.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the center of this loop, there is a single dark hole in the ceiling.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm flying, so I'm up near it. Can I investigate it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Careful, please?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not poking my head into it, I want to get a closer look.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what she said last time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, make an intelligence check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Investigation or perception? You said perception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you looking for?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just want to get a closer look at the circle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make it perception. I'll say sure, why not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, glancing at the circle, I mean, it has a similar small gold band around the outside of it, but this mural is built around this central hole. It's about three feet across, it's not very big, and it goes straight up into darkness.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It said in the previous room, "the sky is a window." Does that pertain to this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It might.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It could. It said, "the water a door."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Which we came through.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, and the hole is right above the water, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It lines up. It lines up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Vax, double-check the gold floor, I'm not--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there any runes on the gold around that circle on the ceiling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking around the gold itself, no, but you're looking at the actual mural itself this close up, there is a texture to the painting itself, and you can see embedded within elements of the actual brushwork and where the flames meet the rock, you can see hidden lines. With what appear to be very very faint runes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it the same language that was around the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What languages do you know?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Abyssal, Draconic, Elvish--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These are rooted in Draconic. Very ancient, this is the basis of what most arcane runes are created from, as Draconic is the base root of arcane writing. None of them spell anything you understand with your knowledge of Draconic, however that is the base root of this writing, as ancient as it is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pike? Does this mean anything to you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: By the way, Matt, I rolled my second natural one of the night for my intelligence check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You have no idea what this is about, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm trying to get water out of my ear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike's looking up and says, "This is beyond me, this is very old."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does this harken back to anything that we remember about the telling of the Spark, or the Second Spark?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know, I'm going to make a religion check with her. Not bad. She goes, "Best I can gather, "these represent the elemental chaos, and the center is the prime, our world, that was crafted "out of that chaos when the gods came, just like we were told at the Platinum Sanctuary. That's what "you told me you found there."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All of the elemental realms overlap, which create our realm. Which is why there's gateways.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I walk over to one of the pillars?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it covered with anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're all the same, and they all have that giant gold stone lion head facing outward from each of the pillars.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there writing or anything fancy on the pillar?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I grab the Hunk of Quall and I float it up to the ceiling.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I gave Vex the Hunk of Quall.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey! 15 with a minus two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing really catches your attention.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I knock on it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Solid. Cobalt marble.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The lion heads. Do they have open mouths or closed mouths?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The mouths are closed. You take the Quall--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I take the Hunk up to the ceiling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. What are you doing with it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How did you make this work, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just hold it out like you're searching for a signal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you hold it up, and you see the bauble glows ever so faintly, and whenever you drift it over the mural, all the runes that are within a foot of it slightly glow as it passes over them, almost like a blacklight. It reveals them ever so faintly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does that mean these are magic? I can't remember what this thing does.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it means that there's magical essence, it finds magic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take some of the water from the pool, and I'm going to bring it to one of the columns and dash it on the column and see what happens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You take the water--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: On the, yeah, the water column.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You throw it on the column that matches the water overhead. You feel this slight grinding shift of stone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wind blows! Fire burns!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Really? Really? We had to bring it there? Really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance around and the lion's mouth has opened.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good call, Percy!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, what are the other elements? Fire, air?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I go over to one of the other pillars and blow on it, the one under the air part.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Same crumbling sound of stone and the mouth of the lion is now open.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, ooh, fire, fire!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I use the Flametongue dagger.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you brush it across the pillar, once again, the lion mouth opens on the outside of the pillar.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do we do earth?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's an earth elemental, or she can do earthy things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I Druidcraft some earth and start wrapping it around the pillar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Suddenly each mouth of the lion begins to pour a constant cavalcade of sand. The pool immediately fills up, you guys noticing, this room, as wide as it is, across the way other holes have opened up in the side and sand is pouring in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit. I fly up into the hole in the ceiling--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! A fucking hourglass? (yelling)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I fly up into the hole. I drop the endless rope down from the hole as I'm flying it up so there's a rope in the middle of the room; so that everybody can go for, I'm flying up--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If the sand fills up, we can ride the sand up to the hole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you ride up through the top, you go up about 60 feet to the very top before you get there. You have to take a second to go ahead and rummage and find the rope. The rope is on you at all times?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not in the Bag of Holding?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's on my cloak. Rope of Infinite Twine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, it's a robe. It's--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a robe, it's not a rope. It's from the inside of a robe or jacket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A pocket on the inside of the robe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. You would have to get that from Grog first, it was probably in the Bag of Holding.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck! All right, fine, I fly back down-- Gimme gimme gimme the rope.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I give it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, at this point the sand has now come up to your knees, waist area, and you're having to climb out and get on top.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan, grab your horn, call out, say that Osysa sent us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I tell him to hold on to one end as I fly up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't you have a cone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The weight of both of you across it, especially with your weight, the broom (pff).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I let go, the rope should be coming out of the robe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, okay. I thought you were trying to lift him up with you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No no no, I'm trying to let the rope out as I'm flying up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You pull up and you come off the top again into this chamber that leads into it. You can see with what your vision is a tunnel that leads ahead to a set of double metal doors.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there anything to tie rope off onto?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about the doors? Are there handles?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you can look over there, no. They are solid metal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan, can I borrow your horn? Your cone?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I can yell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, about half the room is filled now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I grab Scanlan's horn. Osysa sent us, can you hear us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear that voice echo up through.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Gather close next to me, who's close nearby? I do a Wall of Stone as a pillar and pillar us up towards the hole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Elevator time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is a three-foot-wide hole. You'll be able to fit one person through there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I at least rise us up to where we're close and we can get there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, yeah, so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where we're up and out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you get up out of the sand, now you guys have been climbing up best you can, but as the nature of sand you're still pulling in, as it's pouring in now, you see now, parts of the ceiling are starting to open.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keyleth! Do you have the Immovable Rod?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do have the Immovable Rod.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I fly down and I grab the Immovable Rod.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here, catch, yeah, take it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you grab the rod. You fly up, you take the rod and you set it in place there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tie the rope onto it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tie the rope onto it. All right. At this point now the sand's pushed up. You guys are on the last ten feet before it hits the ceiling.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Climb it, climb it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Climbing, climbing the rope, climbing the rope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to go ahead and I'm going to go and turn into a bird.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I fly back down and grab Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well I go down and I grab Pike then and I go up on the broom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Pike goes, "Thank you!" You grab her and she holds onto the edge of the broom and you guys make it up that way. No, since the hole is just small enough where you pretty much have to go through single-file, so nobody else can climb while you're doing that. You guys go through, who's coming up first?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm flying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You fly up after them. Who's going up first?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll go up next.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make an athletics check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Athletics or acrobatics?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be athletics, because you're climbing a rope, a tiny--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The hole, is it triangular?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's circular.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19, okay. Making your way up. It's a long pull.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to Batman.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Who's up next?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd like to use acrobatics to ignore the rope and use the sides of this little tunnel to do that going up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, okay, go ahead and do that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys get up a third of the way, who's after you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I guess I'm climbing the rope. There's a rope, yes? Climbing that rope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. Make an athletics check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're just like--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 25 again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 again. Awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23. You guys make it up two-thirds of the pathway, now. You can see now the sand has reached the bottom, and at this point, you guys who made it up to the top, you look up as you notice part of the stonework above goes (fwsh) and sand begins to now fall directly on top of you guys, pushing past you. I need you guys to make one more check, with disadvantage because of the sand, because that was what the time limit was going to do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's gone, it's gone!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as the timer went out, that was when the top one went boom, and capped off the top.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is an athletics check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is athletics, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, not 27, 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What'd you roll with dis--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 with disadvantage?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 25 acrobatics.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25. You actually have to climb over Percy to get past, because Percy's being held up from the sand that is coming down. Grog, it's starting to catch up to you. You, I need Vax and Scanlan, you guys make it to the top and pull your weight out of the sand that's now pouring down in that tunnel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The tunnel on top?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The top of the tunnel, yeah, you guys emerge from it and you're now inside a chamber along with Vex and Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So the only people that are left are Percy and Grog?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy and Grog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pike?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike was brought up by Vex.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Second roll was 11, 19 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 total?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have a regular 50-foot rope and I'm tying a loop and I'm going to throw it down towards Grog and try to get it down so he can hold onto it and help pull while he does what he's doing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I cantrip a Gust against the sand to try and blow some of it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a lot of sand, you might be able to help a little bit with your cantrip, it's more of a puff of wind than a strong force, and it's a lot of sand falling. It's not going to help tremendously on this circumstance, unfortunately, as a cantrip.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I use Pike's shield and try to direct it to where some of it isn't coming--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, go ahead and make a strength check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, maybe Pike should do it, because she's way stronger than me!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Pike's going to step forward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's got 19 strength now!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't do this, Pike, don't do this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. She manages to direct some of the flow, which begins to spray onto the outside of the room, begins to fill up one side, however that does give a round of no disadvantage to Grog and Percy. Roll again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Except I'm exhausted, right? So I have disadvantage anyway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to make it up the rest of the way. The rope, Percy comes out. Pull him up onto the side. Pike, unfortunately, it's too much and loses it. The sand comes rushing down on top of you. What'd you roll?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I grab Grog by the beard and pull.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's almost to the top, because you made one check, that's your second check now. Need you to make one more check now as the sand's pouring down, it's now come up to you and it's starting to grab the lower part of your legs, and you're starting to feel yourself being buried.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm pulling on his beard, can I cancel his disadvantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Perception is four, but I rolled a 24 on my fourth--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With disadvantage?

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice! So you don't even see the rope that Vax dropped. It keeps in the sand. But you, grabbing onto the one that's already up there, you hand-over-hand pull up. You guys watch as the sand eventually stops, and fills the entirety of the tunnel and stops. And then (thud, slam) Grog pulls himself outside, manages to brush the sand off, it's all in his beard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anyone feel like a nap? Fucking hell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I start shaking out his beard and getting all the crap out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And it's like, fwang!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I cantrip Gust, brush him off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought we were doing what we were supposed to do down there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think we did do what we were supposed to do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jeez, it would've been better if we would've just gone up the hole.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck, I've never rolled that well in my life.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was the time to do it, man. So you guys now see there is a long stone brick hallway before you. It's solid behind you, with a little bit of sand that's now coasted from the corner after Pike had diverted it briefly. Beyond the way, about 30 feet ahead of you, you see two metallic doors that are closed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Traps, I'm looking for traps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's good. That is a 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take a moment, scanning the floor as you approach, coming up to the actual doors, you take a minute to look them over. They are not locked, nor are they trapped.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I never trust that. That's never been good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 30 for stealth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What did that riddle say? Something about a name. A name must be earned?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're in a room with two doors? Is that it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct, a hallway with two doors.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A name is earned. Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So maybe this is us earning our name.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or his name.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, so we went through water, we went through sand.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now there's fire.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And wind.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We haven't gone through fire or wind yet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was really smart, Grog.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Deathwalker's Ward, I'll have resistance to fire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that would take a short rest to go ahead and set that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm okay with that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's sit and let Grog catch a breath, shall we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You taking a short rest or no? Up to you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'll take it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it cure exhaustion if he takes a short rest?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, long rest cures exhaustion.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, fuck that shit, I'm rolling through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) All right, you guys take a short rest, you take a breather here, if you need to use any hit dice, now you can. All right, so. Finish the short rest, you've reset your armor to fire resistance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there any runes or anything around in this room that look like they would indicate--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the short rest, in the time you've taken, while there were no traps in the door, you guys did notice that there is a very, very faint symbol in the metal. Very large, so at first it just seemed like it was part of the door's design, but as you step back and rest, you glance over at the door, Keyleth, looking at it from this distance, you can see the symbol--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ooh, he's got paper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is the ancient original symbol of Ioun. This is what is a relief in each of the doors, ever so faintly, where only at a distance would you be able to really see it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it the exact same in both doors?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not a mirror image, not one blue one green?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it is the exact same.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Should we open a door?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, do you want to bust out those Ioun stones you have?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe there's a clue in here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You also have your Ioun stones.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, but what's that going to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In the walls and in the floors and in the ceiling, is it just the same marble and stone, are there any porous openings or--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was that second line? "Knowledge dost billow--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "All realms are the shore. The sky is a window, the water a door."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Looking about, the stonework is pretty consistent here. It's old, but unlike the weathered entrance, a lot of this has not seen the elements since it's fairly buried, and even at its seemingly ancient time that it's been here, it doesn't appear to be worn, looks fairly fresh. You don't see any weaknesses, you don't see missing stones.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's stone, though, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is stone, yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like marble, or?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, actually, this is more old, classic granite or other deep-earth stones that are used for various forms of construction. Doesn't have any special properties that you can recognize.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, if no one else is going to, I think it'll be funny.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Take 20 paces back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And do what?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And wait for me to open the door and look in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, why don't I open the door and look in?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. I'm a little better at being invisible, but go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which door?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Both of them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both doors (creak) open. You look into what appears to be a, from what you can see, because there is a very, very faint bit of light emanating from his dagger, but beyond that it is pitch darkness. Percy is the one who cannot see.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do you see, Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was great. Do I need to make another stealth check at this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nah, it maintains.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, so I'm going to-- Just stay back, there's no point in all of us getting with something. And I move 20 feet ahead of everybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check at this point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm peeking through the door at this point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, she does as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Perception, you said? 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking to the edge of the two pathways you can see, there appears to be a little bit of a shimmer or bit of movement, like light silk, almost like threads shifting, entwined, it looks almost like a large, very, very faint web that is draped over one wall on the right and matching on the left side.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does it remind me of anything I've seen in my dreams?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And there are a few of them that you can see before the rest of your perspective on the two walls that break it into three passageways.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't hear any eight-legged friends around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't see any currently at this position. Ahead of you, in the central chamber, you do see what looks to be a small pit, like a divot. Almost like a cauldron, about ten feet across. Similar in size and circular structure as the first water pool you guys dove into, except for it comes to a convex end with nothing visible in it. There's like stones built around the outside of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I could be grasping at straws, but I'm getting a bit of an arachnid vibe in here. I'm not sure. There's three passages, there's webbing of some kind to the left and to the right, and some sort of divot or bowl on the ground. I think you can all come in. Quietly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I walk up next to him. Oh yeah, I see what you're talking about. Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I sense any spiders?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You actually do not sense any spiders.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we're good on spiders.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Conscious of the creation of air currents, I'm going to gingerly put on my mask so that my breath does not move things, and examine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make an investigation check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Smart. While he's doing that, I want to use Primeval Awareness to sense celestials.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that is one of the entities that you can check with that? Okay. What'd you roll, Taliesin?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is a thread and there are multiple-- as you get closer, you can see there are many threads that are partway through this 15, 20-foot wide hallway on the far right that you've gone to and inspected. This network of threads appear to be attaching at the halfway point and then draped against the wall, what looks like a spiderweb made of this thread all converges in the center. That's the best you can make of it. You do not sense any celestials.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The hell's a celestial?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But do mark off your spell slot for that use.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's not a spell slot, it's just my-- Oh! Expend one ranger spell slot! I have never, ever done that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I assumed you were keeping track of that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have never even looked at that bold--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, going forward--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It is in bold print.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow. I am sorry about that, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there any way to cross the room without touching the web?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Essentially, it's a 15, 20-foot wide thing, the web only starts about partway and encompasses the side of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And is there anything behind the webs? Just rubble?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Behind the webs, the hallway continues and then ends and then continues right. It's almost like it's a square room that has walls here that split it into three different passages and they all converge again on the opposite side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we see all the way to the end?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's very mini-golf.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16? You notice at the end of the two hallways on the sides, beyond the spiderweb in the corner, there are two small five, six-foot-wide pools of water similar to the ones you dove into that are lined with stones and a little bit of gold trim similar to what you guys saw in the previous room.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Those doorways?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you have the rubble's on the side, you have the spiderwebs, you have the pools at the end there, and you have the empty cauldron in the center piece, but you cannot see, unless you move further forward, you cannot see beyond where those hallways converge on the opposite side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it just me, or does that one in the middle look like a fire pit?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I agree. I think this looks like a convergence-of-the-elements type of a room.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We have some boar in the frozen bag.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You want to start cooking here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can light a fire in that pit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it far away? You can set my arrow on fire and send it down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nah. It's 25 feet from the doors you guys entered in

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Just don't want to walk down there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The last time we did that, shit went down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's get in the doorway and then if something happens we shut the doors.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, can we walk over to the cauldron first and see what's above it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you want to walk in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vax. Okay, as you walk up, make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As they're having this conversation, looking about and floating back, I know your passive as well, but even mid-conversation with him, as you kept an eye out, you see too that to the front of each of these walls that bisects the room, what you thought was just a wall, now as you've had time to study it in quiet as everybody else has been talking during these experiments-- Scanlan, you probably would've noticed this too-- the wall is, the separator's actually a giant obelisk on each side, just like the one that you saw in the Frostweald on the way in that the basilisks were around. You see they're much newer, they're not as weathered by the ages, and they're these two markers with the symbol of Ioun carved into them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shorthalt, come here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oi? Oi, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: These are like the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's like the one that we saw before.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, do you still have the doohickus?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course I have my doohickus.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you want us to shove it in the hole?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You realize that I was born to shove things in holes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's why I called you over, man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, so which one?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Eenie, meenie, miney, mo. Catch a druid by the toe. If she hollers, let her go, eenie, meenie, miney--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, we've always found that very offensive. I just want to say that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll choose the right one and I'll stick my Ioun stone in it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, looking at the base of it, you see there is the same triangular symbol there. You place the Ioun stone into the recess in the obelisk. As you do, it glows faintly, the obelisk itself tends to give off the same teal, greenish-blue glow, the other one also does the same. At which point the darkness across the room is immediately dissipated as two previously unseen braziers across the way burst into flame, lighting the opposite side of the room. You can see what looks to be a series of heavy steps that lead up to a higher platform on the opposite side of the room. You can see two pillars at the edge on the very top of this raised platform that meet the ceiling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, let's go up there and check it out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my gosh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I like it. You want a hand?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I push Scanlan a bit up ahead of me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So this is going over the firepit, past the wispy--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's all the stuff on the sides and the central room has that pit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hold your breath as you pass the wispy wisps, I don't trust them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get that silver tongue of yours ready, all right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think anything's going to want to talk to us down here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we look at the ground for (laughs) for traps as we're walking? Any squares that might move?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yup. Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing catches your attention.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, we're good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would you like me to do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you guys all moving in the different ways, the same way? Which way are you taking?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If we go to the right or the left, we have to cross these webs? Or no?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can move around the web on that, it only covers half the path, you still have about seven to ten feet of clearance between where the web starts and the wall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just open with a brazier at the end.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't we each take a direction?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'll take the left.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll take the middle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take the right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys all quietly move forward, stepping through these passages, stepping around, you can see, like I said, the crumbled walls in the far corner, you can see the webbing there, there are the small pools at the far end corners before they converge again into the central chamber where that giant platform is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And my mask on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, I could just bamf over to the other side. Should I just do that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe you should do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are partway across now. Are you stopping?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to continue not disturbing the air as best I can.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we're moving very slowly, not disturbing the air.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, are you doing anything?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'll Dimension Door to the platform on the other side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it glances at Scanlan, and it is massive in comparison to your tiny gnomish frame, the marble is then tucked deep into what looks like hair of some kind before it disappears, the eyes still glowing the blue color. Suddenly the form begins to move as two giant arms (impacts), and a voice comes billowing out of this entity. "I have watched you come." The creature now stands on all fours. A good 15, 20 feet taller than you, Scanlan. A body similar and lionlike to Osysa's, only thicker and rippling with muscle beneath the fur. The face is masculine and human-like, cheeks adorned with ceremonial marks, head wreathed in a thick mane of red-brown hair. Two enormous feathered wings stretch out from its back, with a giant whoosh, a whoosh of wind that tends to cause the braziers to shift in place. And it looks at you for a second, expectantly, then to the rest of the others.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hello. Osysa sent us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing over your shoulder, you guys can see now the empty pit in the center of the hall behind you is now whipping into a whirlwind and what appears to be a small centralized cyclone that's now rising up, meeting the ceiling, staying stationary in place, arcing there. The braziers flame up even brighter now, the flames, you can feel the heat even from your distance at this point. You can see now the sphinx is baring its gleaming white teeth there at the top. "What. Is. My. Name?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll initiative.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have no fucking clue!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, that just happened.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: His name, what is his name?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm back, baby.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The golden snitch lives!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have the worst initiative rolls all the time except for earlier today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. So. 25 to 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Damn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jeez Louise.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Any ideas?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Very, I, yes? Maybe? I don't know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That map is awesome.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All the elements are there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Look at the fire. (laughs)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah, we got flickering braziers, guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa, that's lit, it's lit up! How did you do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dwarven Forge has cool stuff. Thank you guys.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fucking Dwarven Forge, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so that brings us to 15 to ten?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog. Anyone else?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, and Pike is actually before Grog. All right. Percy, you're up first.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He hasn't attacked us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What is his name, Percy?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Atreyu.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to pull back to that water pit. I'm going to examine it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The water doesn't seem natural.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to scoop some of the water with my mask, pull the mask off, scoop water, and try and toss it at the flame that's right next to me. That's my move.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You put the mask in and your hand moves into it. Your hand gets extremely cold suddenly. You don't see it beneath the surface; it almost vanishes below the water. It's really unsettling. You pull it up and the water is there in your mask. You throw it and the water, it evaporates and the flames flicker slightly, but they's too strong and it doesn't seem to have much of an effect on the brazier.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fascinating. All right. That's my move.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. That's your move and your action. All right, that ends Percy's turn. Vax, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How are we supposed to know your name? Is it Osyso?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Teeth are bared and it's sitting there looking at all of you, waiting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to click my Boots of Haste. Can I use a bonus action to hide and then hold? Any stuff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could, yeah, you can move and then hold your action to a trigger point if you want to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where am I in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're right here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So I'm going to hide. I'm going to move backward around the corner and hide.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Around this way?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you can move there. Go ahead and roll for hide.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I'm going to hold for the moment he attacks any of my friends.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You feel like the air in your lungs gets butterflies for a second and something, even though this place is stationary, it's almost like the whole place shifts. I need everybody to make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Damn, I'm back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Saving throw, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, constitution saving throw.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With disadvantage, 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog and Vex, you're right next to each other, you both glance at each other and you can see, it's like Grog's skin has aged suddenly. His-- around his eyes it's grown a little more sunken, his muscles have sagged slightly. He looks, not ancient by any means, but it looks like he's seen about another 15 to 20 years of travels.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What does that mean?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You also have, although due to your gnome lineage it has less of an effect, and no one's noticed it at this distance, but if anyone gets a quick glance, you'll see a few grey hairs starting to sprout on the side of Scanlan's head.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I get rid of those.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Vex, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Do I feel old?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You feel like you've been pulled through something, but it doesn't have a mighty effect, although, Grog, glancing at Vex you can see there is definitely a little bit more of a weathered look to her, crow's nests forming, deep-seated frown lines.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, jeez. I shout out-- I run towards the other water portal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I shout out, Pike, do you know the names of the four ancient gods? Is your name four? That's stupid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There doesn't seem to be a reaction. Pike goes, "No, I mean, the gods that were at the "beginning, there's--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There was Pelor and Melora and, I mean, they're the ones who cast away the elements, the "chaos that this realm was first. I don't know!" And she seems-- she's bungled and unable to really formulate what you're asking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wouldn't have any religion, anything to base that off of?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a religion check if you want to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow. Wow. Two! That's four ones in a night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wow. Wow. It's the reverse Percy tonight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've been cursed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't recall any of that conversation.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have an advantage on anything having to do with dragons.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has nothing to do with dragons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I was just checking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is the creation myth of all of existence. However, you still have your action if you want to do something. You're by the pool, it's right to your right, and there's this sphinx now rearing--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I saw Percy dip his hand into the water, so I do the same thing to see what it does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You what? You put your--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I put my hand in the water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You dip your hand in the water. The hand, once it breaks the surface, it vanishes into darkness below the water. You don't even see, there's no visual on it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it hurt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it doesn't hurt, it's cold, it's very cold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pull it back out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pull it back out. Your hand is wet and it drips and you shake it free.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I use a bonus action to try to hide? Is there anywhere to hide? Maybe against a wall or something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not going to be able to get completely out of sight. (laughs) Unless you want to jump in the water.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So there's a whirlwind in the center of the room, there's two piles of rocks, there's two vats of water, there's two torches, and then there's two spiderwebs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And the spiderwebs are covering the walls.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will face the sphinx and say: is your name Ioun?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "She is beyond me... What is my name, little "scrumptious one?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hit him!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you have your earpiece in, by the way?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, we all do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. Good to know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, I'm not going to attack this thing if it hasn't attacked me yet, so I'm going to, eee.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's spiderwebs, there's stones, there's fire, there's water--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Working on it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like we're so stupid, we should know this. "The four endure, the four remember."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I hold my attack until a trigger?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can if you want to, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or hold my action until a trigger?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, what do you want to hold it for?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If he makes a move towards me physically.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Remember, you guys who are holding your action, you can interrupt and release at anything if it doesn't happen, be aware of that. All right, so it now goes to the sphinx's turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, this should be fun. We're all standing around with our thumbs up our asses.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yup.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The sphinx takes a step forward to the edge of the stairway and (roars) gives out this earth-shattering roar that shakes-- a couple of stones and dust that are loosened from the ceiling falls down. I need everybody to make a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is this magic?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, it is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it charm, by any chance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not a spell, it is a magical effect.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I get advantage on that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you get advantage from?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Advantage versus magic on saves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From being a gnome?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It says, Gnome Cunning, advantage on wisdom, character, intelligence, magic saves. That's what I wrote down, anyway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let me double-check here just to be sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It doesn't really matter, I rolled shit on both, so it's okay. Don't bother.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Okay. Against magic, so yeah, you would have advantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And does it have anything to do with charm or sleep?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nope, okay. 17.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 11. Disadvantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughs) You picked the wrong day to stop sniffing glue.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What the fuck? (laughs) I know. Paint chips.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You made a bad call.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I made a bad call.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog. Vex, what was it you rolled, again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24. And you rolled?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. That's right. All right, so. As the roar pierces through the hallway, most of you guys steel yourself. Grog, Scanlan, Pike, and Vax, you feel the sudden reality of how fearful and dangerous this creature is. You stepped into the lair of an ancient, powerful entity and you feel like your very life is at stake. You guys are frightened for one minute.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frightened means you have disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while you can see it, and you cannot willingly move closer to the creature. So you have to either move adjacent, like same distance from it, or away. You can make a saving throw every turn to try and resist it. It is now going to stay right where it is. That brings it to Pike's turn. Pike doesn't quite know how to deal with this whole circumstance. She is going to cast--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Text Ashley.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's also the obelisks. We got to go start touching the other shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Obelisks were in Elvish.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Issylra is a continent, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was all written in what, in--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Take a step this way. Pike's going to reach forward and cast Freedom of Movement on you. At fourth level.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. I was going to rage and shake it, but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So for the next hour, you cannot be paralyzed or restrained, you can't have your speed reduced via magical effects. You're still feared, but--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can shake that with a rage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not concentration, either.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you, Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She says, "Go get him, Grog."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You got it, buddy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That ends Pike's turn. Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I might as well do what Pike says. I'm going to bum-rush the sphinx.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Straight-up?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yup.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You rush up the stairs.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With a precariousness of-- we'll say you rush up here for the sake of positioning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure. Two strikes, straight-up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just going to hit it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) Yeah. I'm not smart, this is all I do. 23?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23? That hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: His face is awful. Should I roll damage or roll both attacks first?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's all against him, roll attacks. You're not going to kill it in one hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, that's true.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if it's a nine-point hit point?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 24 on the first one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24 damage, all righty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Second attack. Holy shit, that's a 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice, that hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Something's going to happen to me and it's going to be bad. Six. 11. 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Makes its first constitution saving throw. Fails its second. So you steal another strength point and the sphinx's strength goes down to that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So I'm at 25 now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Down to 79 strength.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're at 25 now. Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I don't go up again until 26. Right? On the evens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. But 25 is the max for this sword. It says on the weapon, it should be under ability.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, you're right, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pull the strength from it. As you do, a voice in your head goes, "Yesss."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, as you look at the blade, the blade now begins to emanate a shadow aura stronger than previously that begins to also form around your upper shoulders, drifting. The blade suddenly extends another foot, the edges of it that were smooth project with a jagged, thorny outside. The blade itself now is longer, thicker, and far more dangerous-looking than it was before. Until your next short rest, all attacks with the sword do an additional 2d6 necrotic damage.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) Super Saiyan, motherfucker! 2d6 necrotic damage? Okay. And I'll stay there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And await my punishment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. At the end of your turn, the sphinx is going to use its three legendary actions.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Three legendary actions?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is going to use three of them to cast a spell out of order. It's going to go ahead and call down a Flame Strike.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're all going to die!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Onto the twins.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why?!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I attack him now, while he's casting, because I held my turn?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, actually, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, so I'm hidden and Grog's next to him, which would normally put me at advantage, but he's got me afraid, which puts me at disadvantage, which means it cancels out and it's one straight roll, right? On the attacks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Good. So I'm going to throw-- I'm hasted, I'm going to throw two daggers at him. The first one is, probably hits, where's the freaking page? 23 for the first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23 hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 18 for the second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do they both hit or just the first? I'm only doing two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What was the second one? It was--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, so the first one is seven, the second is seven. And I want to use the rest of my turn to, as I'm hasted, to run around to the back of that obelisk and start reading.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All right. As you're doing that reaction shot, it calls down the column, hits both of you before you can burst off. All of a sudden, as you look over at your brother, you feel this rising energy before all of a sudden this entire area is (boom) consumed in burning holy divine light. I need both of you guys to make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to use evasion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, evasion happens automatically as part of your reaction to that, so yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dexterity, so 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You rolled a what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 30 dexterity saving throw?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, eff it, I'm going to use my last Luck of the day. Ugh, barely any better. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 for you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Right, so Vex? You take half damage from this. You take full damage, unfortunately. So that's going to be 21 points of fire and radiant damage to you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is half?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 is the half. You, however, have resistance to fire, Liam.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the 22 points of fire damage you would've taken is reduced to 11.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: With evasion, if I fail, I take half damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, so yeah, so you would take, so you would take the same, but a quarter because of halving fire damage to take from that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So I didn't hear the number because I was reading, what was--?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 21, so half 21 would be 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, radiant damage you're not resistant to, so I'd say it would be 17 points of damage. There you go. You rush out of the flames and find your way around the obelisk. However, you have to wait until your turn before you can take a look at that. All right, now it comes to Keyleth's turn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I yell out: Issylra!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't seem to have any effect.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, that might be a continent.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the continent where Vasselheim is, and--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not his name. And I cast Control Water again and I start pouring the water out of the pools and onto the fire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The water comes out as a column, doesn't appear to be coming to an end, you're not quite sure where it's being drawn from, it's this constant stream, and as it hits the flame (tshhh) but the flames aren't going out. It's all turning to steam and it's filling the room with steam and the more and more it pours into it, the more and more the room is beginning to become obscured and making it hard to see.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, well, I stop that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you do, the streams stop water. The pools are still completely still where you've pulled it out of, seemingly unbothered other than the little bit of wind that's blowing, and have not lessened in their volume at all.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good to know. Can I do some sort of check to see if I would've heard anything about this type of a thing in my druid time, is this like a different plane of existence, what is this shit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What, this place you are?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, or would I know of what his name would be from the telling of the Second Spark and any of my elemental knowledge as a druid?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intelligence check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh, that's good. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19. Thinking back about the stories you've heard, which isn't a whole lot necessarily. Are we good on the stream?

lines.name: RYAN
lines.text: (off-camera) Yeah, we're good on the stream.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Had a little flicker.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We had a little flicker. You recall, go through, poring through all the information that was given to you, you don't know a whole lot about the history element, it isn't a part of the druidic training experience, but based on the discussion with Highbearer Vord, no mention of a sphinx, nothing like that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck. I don't know, you guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think that's your turn, though. Unless you want to move.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. I'm good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. End of your turn, the shimmering webs on each side flash for a second, and stepping out of them, you can see a slightly translucent, not fully physical spider on each side.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fey spiders, you son of a-- oh god, I keep hitting that, we got to fix that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This spider immediately (skittering) up to Percy. And this one (skittering) up to Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah, c'mon!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Versus you, Percy, rolled a one. Completely missed. It goes and reaches out towards you, out of the way. Vex, however, that is a 23.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That hits me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. You go ahead and suffer--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You go ahead and suffer!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Top of the round, Percy, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, well if, at the end of the round, have I not gone yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have not gone yet, do you want to?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I mean, I guess I'll attack at this point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will try and fail to put him into the Resilient Sphere. Which I'm sure will fail. (laughs)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What is the DC on the Resilient Sphere?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I don't have my stuff with me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe if it's through the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Through the hand cone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The hand cone I think is 20 now, isn't it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's 20 now, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so it doesn't make its dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But I have disadvantage on attack, but that doesn't matter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. You attempt to create the sphere around it. As you can see it begins to encase the sphinx, and the sphinx just-- its head, after staring at Grog, goes (growls), and as it roars at you, the sphere that's formed around it shatters and the arcane essence is scattered about the room and vanishes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I ask him if his name is Earned?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He sits there glaring at you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, that's a stupid question, sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe say it in Celestial.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know Celestial!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Say it in Celestial, Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so that's Percy's turn now, Percy, what are you doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The first thing I'm going to is, I'm going to guess a name, because that's fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to yell, Lux! Whatever that would be in Celestial. First light.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You shout out, and the sound of Celestial being spoken has this echo to it, this, Lux, and it fades afterward. It has no immediate effect, the wind seems to swallow it around you from all the noise going around. The sphinx has no interest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fine, I'm going to take a slash at that spider with my sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't suppose that there's a keyword dragon in there anywhere?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A what?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't suppose there's a keyword dragon anywhere in that spider's description, but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) No, there isn't.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pissing in the wind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's okay. It is a magical sword you're attacking with, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It is a magical sword I'm attacking with. That's 11 points of slashing damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This spider is scattered into ether.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With my sword out, I'm going to run down the hall and I'm going to take two more slashing attacks at the web.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and roll.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 17, but really, how hard is it to hit a web?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's more about finding the right place to do the proper damage, but that works, go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 13 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You cut through some of the threads, it limps on one side, but it's still keeping itself aloft.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that hits, go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ooh. 15 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 points of damage. All right. With that, the second strike, the thread dissipates and turns into smoke and vanishes from existence. None of the threads remain, it vanishes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there anything written on the wall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll an investigation check.
